description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in the New York region:

title: Using the TV App for iOS
description: Q. I upgraded my iPad to iOS 10 and noticed the Videos app has been replaced with an app called TV, but it wont let me play any of my videos unless I have an internet connection. Did Apple do this on purpose? How am I supposed to watch movies on a plane?

title: Flecks of Extraterrestrial Dust, All Over the Roof
description: After decades of failures and misunderstandings, scientists have solved a cosmic riddle  what happens to the tons of dust particles that hit the Earth every day but seldom if ever get discovered in the places that humans know best, like buildings and parking lots, sidewalks and park benches.

title: My 10 Favorite Books: Michelle Dockery
description: For his bookshop and website One Grand Books, the editor Aaron Hicklin asked people to name the 10 books theyd take with them if they were marooned on a desert island. The next in the series is the actress Michelle Dockery, who is best known for her role in Downton Abbey. Dockery co-stars in The Sense of an Ending, which opens in select theaters on March 10. She shares her list exclusively with T.

title: Honey, Please Pick Up Some Grilled Tilapia at the Gas Station
description: LEESBURG, Va.  Last summer, when two women were looking for a restaurant space in this Northern Virginia town of 48,000, one of the options held multiple enticements: It was affordable, it had a good location, the kitchen was fit for Asian cooking and it was in a gas station.

title: The N.C.A.A Tournament Challenge: Determining Whos In and Whats Their Seed
description: The most important and controversial annual function of the selection committee for the N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament is to decide which 36 teams merit at-large bids into the final field alongside the 32 conference champions that qualify automatically.

title: What Kind of Sleeper Are You?
description: Always tired? Find out why.

title: Nigerias Battles With Boko Haram Scar the Land and Its People
Tech Roundup: Julian Assange as Tech Companies Defender
description: Julian Assange, the founder of WikiLeaks, now appears to be a defender of American technology companies.

title: Highest and Lowest Property Tax Rates in the U.S.
description: When budgeting for a home purchase, its important to carefully consider property taxes; they can make up a sizable chunk of your monthly payment. But property taxes affect everyone, including those who dont own. After all, the landlords property taxes are coming from your monthly rent.

title: Paperback Row
description: Six new paperbacks to check out this week.

title: U.N. Accuses Turkey of Killing Hundreds of Kurds
description: GENEVA  Turkeys military and police forces have killed hundreds of people during operations against Kurdish rebels in southeastern Turkey, the United Nations said on Friday in a report that listed summary killings, torture, rape and widespread destruction of property among an array of human rights abuses.

title: Shopping for Clocks
description: With daylight saving time beginning this weekend, clocks will get more attention than usual. Some people may marvel at later sunsets; others will simply curse timepieces that are difficult to adjust.

title: In the Kitchen With Joanne Fluke, Author of the Hannah Swensen Culinary Mysteries
description: Bon Apptit: The term cozy mystery always makes me laugh  you do realize theres a corpse here, right, people? Surely some enterprising novelist will churn out Murder Most Hyggelig soon. Until then, the coziest cozies remain those by Joanne Fluke, whose Hannah Swensen culinary mysteries star a small-town Minnesota baker and feature recipes alongside the dead bodies; her latest, Banana Cream Pie Murder, is new at No.3 in hardcover fiction.

title: The Yankee Clippers: Clint Frazier Gets a Trim
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Deep inside Steinbrenner Field, the unkindest cut of all took place early Friday morning  Clint Fraziers hair.

title: Kids Are Getting Older Quicker. And Disney Tries to Adapt.
description: BURBANK, Calif.  Grandma is mad. Her grown daughter, Bex, who got pregnant as a teenager, just blazed back into town and let a big secret slip. Grandma had raised 13-year-old Andi to believe that Bex was her older sister. Well, the truth is a tad more complicated.

title: Copy Edit This! Quiz No. 4
description: The Timess standards editor, Philip B. Corbett, invites readers to correct grammatical errors in recent New York Times articles.

title: What Happens When You Fight a Deep State That Doesnt Exist
description: The Trump administration, in its fight against the deep state, could risk exacerbating the very problems it has pinned on shadowy bureaucratic forces: leaking, internal conflict and the politicization of institutions like intelligence agencies.

title: Trump Immigration Crackdown Is Great for Private Prison Stocks
description: Nightmarish as the last two months have been for immigrants threatened by detention or deportation, it has been a marvelous time for two companies that stand to benefit from the Trump administrations policies.

title: Trumps Plan on Fannie and Freddie? Clues May Emerge Soon
description: Fixing Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, the mortgage finance giants that still operate under government supervision, is nowhere near the top of the Trump administrations to-do list. Since the election, administration officials, including Steven T. Mnuchin, the United States Treasury secretary, have said little about their plans for the companies.

title: Review: In Documentaries on Syria, Much Despair and a Dash of Hope
description: If the idea of cozying up to Russia strikes you as harmless, or all those Syrian refugees are too far away to seem real, the HBO documentary Cries From Syria is something you ought to watch. But be prepared for an unrelenting blast of misery without a lot of context.

title: The French Love to Eat This. Why Dont Americans?
description: It remains a mystery to me why a delicious rabbit dinner, a habit in France, is such a hard sell in the United States, a meal many Americans would shy away from. This is not to say that you cant buy rabbit here, but you dont see it on a daily basis in butcher shops or at the supermarket.

title: A Lake Turned Pink in Australia. Its Not the Only One.
description: Over the past week, the internet has been getting excited over a hot-pink lake in the heart of Melbourne. And despite what science fiction nostalgia it may conjure up, this is not a scene from Ghostbusters or The X-Files. This is very much a real, natural phenomenon that occurs all over the planet. Its what happens when the only thing living in a supersalty lake is a single-celled, salt-loving microbe that makes pigments called carotenoids.

title: Trump Keeps Low Profile After Praising Health Care Overhaul
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump praised House Republican leaders on Friday for their plan to overhaul the Affordable Care Act, but otherwise kept a conspicuously low profile, with a newfound silent treatment of the news media.

title: Life With Dad, the Funeral Director
description: Before the age of 12, I had seen about a dozen dead bodies. It was actually a pretty typical childhood  or at least it was for me, because my father was a funeral director.

title: In This Ballet, a Sweetly Disturbing Confection From Alexei Ratmansky
description: A Viennese pastry shop, dancing sweets, a little boy who overindulges and a revolution by the lower pastry orders. An almost unknown Richard Strauss score. Dcor and costumes by the pop-surrealist artist Mark Ryden. And a great title: Whipped Cream! Its really wonderful, Alexei Ratmansky said of his full-length work for American Ballet Theater after a long day of rehearsal last week.

title: What Were Reading
description: New York Times reporters and editors are highlighting great stories from around the web. You can receive What Were reading by email, and let us know how you like it at wwr@nytimes.com.

title: Michael Flynn Was Paid to Represent Turkeys Interests During Trump Campaign
description: WASHINGTON  The candidate he was advising last fall was running on a platform of America First. The client he was working for last fall was paying him more than $500,000 to put Turkey first.

title: The Playlist: Nicki Minaj Strikes Back, and Fleet Foxes Return With a Folky Epic
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos  and anything else that strikes them as intriguing. You can listen to this playlist on Spotify here. Like this Playlist? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com, and sign up for our Louder newsletter here.

title: Woman Detained After Speaking About Deportation Fears Is Released
description: A 22-year-old undocumented immigrant who was detained by the authorities last week after speaking out about her deportation fears was released on Friday, her lawyers and rights groups said.

title: The Top 10 Moments of Paris Fashion Week
description: Paris Fashion Week marked a few important milestones: The designer Dries Van Noten held his 100th runway show, a celebratory marker of a brilliant career. The collection, which featured vibrant prints, oversize silhouettes and jewel-toned faux fur jackets, was modeled by the greatest names in the business, including Amber Valletta, Nadja Auermann and Kirsten Owen  all models who have walked in Van Notens shows since 1993. Later in the week, Jean Touitou of A.P.C. celebrated his 30th year in business with an intimate show at the brands studio on the Left Bank. The collection was about simplicity, but done well: there were no-fuss denim jackets, pants, trench coats and military dresses.

title: Review: John Adams Wrestles the Ghosts of His Musical Fathers
description: The New York Philharmonic opened what was billed as an all-John Adams concert on Thursday with a bit of Beethoven. Mr. Adams, reacting from the stage of David Geffen Hall, said he felt tempted to quit while Im ahead and skip my own piece.

title: Unhappy Customers Make Him Happy, and Rich
description: A few pugnacious companies out there are skeptical about the age-old maxim that the customer is always right. But the Haggler has never encountered a business that delights in calling its customers wrong, and then insults those customers in obscenity-filled emails and YouTube videos.

title: Listen to Songs From the Fashion Month Runways
description: Fashion month, which officially came to a close this week, saw Raf Simonss debut at Calvin Klein  and more than a few political statements on the runway. But aside from what we saw, what we heard at the shows was especially memorable. Some soundtracks offered a direct connection to the collection they accompanied: At Chanel, for example, Elton Johns Rocket Man blared while a massive rocket emblazoned with the brands logo took off inside Pariss Grand Palais. Elsewhere, soundtracks sent slightly more subliminal messages. Many designers opted for songs that were overtly political, such as David Bowies This Is Not America at Calvin Klein or Richie Havenss Freedom at the Row. Many others featured music by strong female vocalists, such as Nina Simones Funkier Than a Mosquitos Tweeter at Mara Hoffman and an all-out dance party to Christina Aguileras What a Girl Wants at Brandon Maxwell. At Ryan Roche, the designers 13-year-old daughter and her 15-year-old friend sang live versions of songs by Stevie Nicks in a nod to the next generation; and Stella McCartney paid tribute to the late George Michael, with models dancing to a remix of his song Faith.

title: Seven Films to Stream if You Loved Get Out
description: An earlier version of this article was published in March, 2017.

title: A Bridge to Nowhere, 19 Feet 8 Inches Over Lower Manhattan
description: You could look at it as a metaphor for our troubled times.

title: The Greatest Trick Ed Sheeran Ever Pulled Was Convincing the World Hes an Underdog
description: The Popcast is hosted by Jon Caramanica, a pop music critic for The New York Times. It covers the latest in pop music criticism, trends and news.

title: Defending a Prisoners Care
description: To the Editor:

title: Champagne and Donkey Kong at a Herms Party in Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES  Herms played host to a carnival-like evening of cocktails, runway looks and dancing on Thursday night at an industrial warehouse that lay just beyond the usual routes taken by the fashion crowd.

title: F.D.A. Official Under Bush Is Trumps Choice to Lead Agency
description: President Trump said Friday that he intended to nominate Scott Gottlieb, a partner at a venture capital fund with longstanding ties to the pharmaceutical and biotech industries, to lead the Food and Drug Administration.

title: Trumps Environmental Wrecking Ball
description: To the Editor:

title: Helping the Homeless
description: To the Editor:

title: Marines Sex Scandal
description: To the Editor:

title: Wiretaps: Which Statement Is True?
description: To the Editor:

title: A Staten Island Urban Farmer
description: Zaro Bates operates and lives on a 5,000-square-foot farm on Staten Island, which may make her the citys only commercial farmer-in-residence. But instead of a shingled farmhouse surrounded by acres of fields, Ms. Bates lives in a second-floor studio in a midrise apartment complex built on the site of a former naval base overlooking New York Bay.

title: Renting Your Home Out, By the Hour
description: Like other New Yorkers, Alex Story occasionally rents out her home through Airbnb, relinquishing her East Village townhouse to strangers who sleep in her bed, eat in her kitchen and lounge on her sofa. But she has found a less intrusive way to profit from her property: She rents it out by the hour, instead.

title: Stop Beating Black Children
description: This is gonna hurt me more than it hurts you.

title: White-Hot Aria, Engulfing Bass: This Weeks 8 Best Classical Moments
description: In addition to reviews, features and news during the week, our critics and reporters collect the best of what theyve heard: notes that sent shivers down their spines, memorable voices, quotations that cut to the heart of the story.

title: Ouster of South Korean President Could Return Liberals to Power
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The foes of South Koreas likely new leaders have called them blindly nave, closet North Korea followers and anti-American  an unsettling accusation in a country where the alliance with Washington has been the military bedrock for seven decades.

title: Unrest Flares at Nepal-India Border After Fatal Shooting of Nepali
description: KATHMANDU, Nepal  Protests flared on Friday along the border between Nepal and India, a day after Indian security forces fatally shot a Nepali man who was protesting their presence on disputed territory.

title: Two People Die after Eating Raw-Milk Cheese Made in New York State
description: Two people have died following an outbreak of listeria linked to a popular artisanal raw milk cheese made in upstate New York, the authorities said this week.

title: Statue Being Pulled From a Gritty Patch of Cairo Could Be of Ramses
description: CAIRO  The gritty, working-class neighborhood of Matariya in northeast Cairo brims with noise and poverty, a place where motorized rickshaws vie with donkey carts on narrow, trash-strewn streets. But this week, archaeologists began pulling from a patch of barren ground a glistening 26-foot statue they say might be a world-class find.

title: Trump Abruptly Orders 46 Obama-Era Prosecutors to Resign
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration moved on Friday to sweep away most of the remaining vestiges of Obama administration prosecutors at the Justice Department, ordering 46 holdover United States attorneys to tender their resignations immediately  including Preet Bharara, the United States attorney in Manhattan.

title: Mosque Is Blocked in New Jersey, but Dispute Is Far From Over
description: BAYONNE, N.J.  They thought they had found the perfect place to build the first mosque and Islamic community center in this citys history: an empty 8,500-square-foot warehouse at the end of a dead-end block, with room on its lot for 37 parking spots.

title: Paris Fashion Week in 60 Seconds
description: T Magazine's market director, Malina Joseph Gilchrist, recaps the fall/winter 2017 collections from Paris.

title: The Rice-Size Fly That Hits the Bulls-Eye Every Time
description: Despite being just the size of a rice grain, robber flies, which live all over the world, are champion predators. In field experiments, they can detect targets the size of sand grains from nearly two feet away  100 times the flys body length  and intercept them in under half a second. Whats more, they never miss their mark.

title: Robin Camp, Canadian Judge, Resigns Over Handling of Rape Trial
description: OTTAWA  A judge who became known throughout Canada for asking a complainant why she could not just keep her knees together during a sexual assault has resigned from Federal Court. It was the latest in a series of episodes that have prompted questions about the handling of sexual assault cases in Canada.

title: Points of No Return
description: Subscribe: iTunes | Google Play Music

title: Los Angeless Thriving Jazz Scene Produces Four New Albums
description: New York remains the popular and commercial center of jazz, but other cities are increasingly dictating its development. Young musicians in places like Philadelphia and Chicago  where systems for intergenerational exchange still thrive outside academia  are marrying established regional patois with a broad base of influences from across the black musical canon, and around the globe.

title: New York Examiner Wont Disclose Cause of Russian Envoys Death
description: UNITED NATIONS  A terse note from the New York City Office of Chief Medical Examiner on Friday saying that it could not disclose the cause and manner of a senior Russian diplomats death in February set off a flood of conspiratorial posts on Twitter, but both Russian and American officials said the announcement was a matter of diplomatic protocol.

title: Trumps Abortion Strategy
description: Divide and conquer. Thats the way to understand President Trumps informal offer to Planned Parenthood: Stop doing abortions and you can keep the federal funding that the House Republican bill to replace Obamacare would otherwise eliminate. The president was reportedly trying to placate both conservatives and his daughter Ivanka, who, during the campaign, apparently pushed him to recognize that millions of women are helped by Planned Parenthood.

title: Paul Taylor Seasons Premieres Lack the Luster of Its Revivals
description: What are we to make of the choreographer Paul Taylor and his annual three-week New York season? His dancers  the company is based here  are among the citys most accomplished, personable and sensuous; his repertory includes many of the worlds most oddly imaginative masterpieces.

title: S.E.C. Rejects Winklevoss Brothers Bid to Create Bitcoin E.T.F.
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission said on Friday it had rejected an application to create an exchange-traded fund tied to the price of Bitcoin.

title: Cast the Trump Mini-Series: Who Should Play the Donald?
description: When news broke that the reporters Mark Halperin and John Heilemann would be writing a book chronicling Donald J. Trumps presidential campaign  and that this book would be turned into an HBO mini-series  we wanted to help Tom Hanks, the executive producer, and the rest of the principals, by offering some casting suggestions.

title: Saudi Aramco I.P.O. May Merit a Social Engineering Discount
description: Saudi Aramco is in danger of undermining its own cash call.

title: Oil Price Drop Triggers a Herd Mentality of Selling
description: HOUSTON  Often turbulent, the oil market had become almost boring the past few months, with prices moving little and hovering around $51 to $56 a barrel.

title: A Red-Tailed Hawk Dies Behind City Hall. Coincidence? Probably.
description: The first corpse was found near the tip of City Hall Park in January  the body of a red-tailed hawk that had dropped dead from some high spot onto the sidewalk. On Friday, a second corpse appeared: Another red-tailed hawk was spotted dead in a tree behind City Hall, not far from Mayor Bill de Blasios second-floor office window.

title: Republican Party, Kong: Skull Island: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Distinguished Writers Debate Sense of Mission in Trump Era
description: Every aspect of our mission is being challenged. Suzanne Nossel, the executive director of PEN America, the literary and human rights organization, was speaking onstage at Cooper Union on Wednesday night. PENs annual general meeting featured a distinguished panel, moderated by Ms. Nossel, of five writers talking about the role of journalism and literature under the presidency of Donald J. Trump.

title: How the Dutch Stopped Being Decent and Dull
description: In normal times, few people outside the Netherlands would have paid the slightest attention to this weeks Dutch parliamentary elections. In normal times, even people who would have paid attention could have expected yet another solid middle-of-the-road government to be formed by a coalition of parties, usually including Christian or Social Democrats, or business-minded conservatives, led by earnest political managers.

title: From Flight 370 Hunt, New Insight Into Indian Oceans Unknown Depths
description: On March 8, 2014, Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 vanished with 239 passengers and crew aboard as it crossed the Indian Ocean, triggering a large-scale search for its remains that lasted nearly three years. As a byproduct of the tragedy, scientists have gained access to more than 100,000 square miles of seafloor mapped at a level of detail that provides a rare look at the oceans geological processes.

title: Smart Republicans?
description: I claim no special expertise in the legislative process. But reading a couple of pieces about what looks like a health care debacle from the good folks at Vox, I have some thoughts about whats going on  namely, dont presume that Ryan and company have any idea what theyre doing.

title: Couldnt Get Into Yale? 10 New York City High Schools Are More Selective
description: And you thought it was hard to get into Yale.

title: Pope Francis Signals Openness to Ordaining Married Men in Some Cases
description: Pope Francis this week signaled receptiveness to appeals from bishops in the remote and overwhelmed corners of the Roman Catholic Church to combat a deepening shortage of priests by ordaining married men who are already committed to the church.

title: Zack Wheeler Makes Solid Start, and Police Stop a Tim Tebow Fan
description: Not every day in spring training is eventful, but Friday certainly was for the Mets.

title: Anthony Beilenson, Congressman Who Fought for Abortion Rights, Dies at 84
description: Anthony Beilenson, a 10-term congressman who persuaded fellow California legislators and Gov. Ronald Reagan 50 years ago to approve what was then one of the nations most permissive abortion rights bills, died on March 5 in Los Angeles. He was 84.

title: Waymo Asks Court to Block Ubers Self-Driving Car Project
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Waymo, the self-driving car business spun out of Googles parent company last year, asked a federal court on Friday to block Ubers work on a competing self-driving vehicle that Waymo claimed could be using stolen technology.

title: Robert James Waller, Author of The Bridges of Madison County, Dies at 77
description: Robert James Waller, whose gauzy, romantic novel The Bridges of Madison County became a runaway best seller on its publication in 1992 and the basis of a popular film, died on Friday at his home in Fredericksburg, Tex. He was 77.

title: After Warily Circling, Trump and Angela Merkel Prepare to Meet
description: WASHINGTON  When President Trump welcomes Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany to the Oval Office on Tuesday, their meeting will take on a symbolism unlike any he has held so far: The great disrupter confronts the last defender of the liberal world order.

title: Daniel Arnolds Tongue-in-Cheek Take on New York Style
description: Daniel Arnold has a fascination with Midtown Manhattan  Its kind of a time capsule of New York, he said  and thats where most of these photos were taken, between November and January. A photographer with over 135,000 followers on Instagram, Mr. Arnold is known for finding humor in everyday New York moments, like people standing around eating hot dogs or dogs pulling on their walkers. In this case, he was also looking for the lively and eccentric style found on the citys wintry streets. He walked us through the moments he captured below.

title: IndyCar Racing, No Longer Spinning Its Wheels, Draws Greater Interest
description: The 100th Indianapolis 500 did such an extraordinary box office last year, drawing the first sellout in race history with an estimated crowd of 350,000, that race officials understood that it would be virtually impossible to match ticket sales for the 101st race on May 28.

title: Their Intimate Photos Were Shared. Now the Marine Corps Wants Them to Speak Up.
description: WASHINGTON  The Marine Corps top officer on Friday urged female Marines whose intimate photos were secretly shared by a members-only Facebook group of active-duty and retired Marines to come forward and cooperate with military investigators.

title: South Korea Breathes a Sigh of Relief
description: SEOUL, South Korea  There was no hesitation, no ambiguity. On Friday, all eight judges on South Koreas Constitutional Court voted to remove Park Geun-hye from the presidency.

title: Carol Field, Italian Food Expert, Dies at 76
description: Carol Field, an authority on Italian cuisine whose classic cookbook The Italian Baker, published in 1985, introduced Americans to regional breads like ciabatta and focaccia, as well as to desserts, died on Friday in San Francisco. She was 76.

title: Dutch Greens Make Inroads Days Before Vote for Parliament
description: AMSTERDAM  In the final days before next weeks parliamentary elections in the Netherlands, the far-right leaders support appeared to be softening and a previously minor party, the Greens, led by a charismatic young politician, was poised to become one of the two top parties on the left.

title: Another Spring (Sort of) for the Architect of the Mets
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  The day after Mets pitchers and catchers reported to the teams spring training facility here a month ago, Sandy Alderson strolled through the clubhouse. He greeted each player by name, and a smile stretched across his face.

title: New Guideline Will Allow First-Year Doctors to Work 24-Hour Shifts
description: First-year doctors in training will now be permitted to work shifts lasting as long as 24 hours, eight hours longer than the current limit, according to a professional organization that sets work rules for graduates from medical schools in the United States.

title: The Triangle: A Simple Name for a Complex Basketball Scheme
description: When Courtney Lee was deciding whether to sign with the Knicks last summer, he did not really take into consideration the offensive system he would be asked to play within. He had already logged eight N.B.A. seasons, and most offenses in the league have only so much variance.

title: With Preet Bhararas Dismissal, Storied Office Loses Its Top Fighter
description: For more than seven years, Preet Bharara, the United States attorney for the Southern District of New York, made a name for himself as one of the nations most aggressive and outspoken prosecutors of public corruption and Wall Street crime.

title: Blade Runner Tests Limits of Prosthetics, Years After Oscar Pistorius
description: A decade after Oscar Pistorius caused track-and-field officials to re-examine their rules regarding the use of prosthetic limbs at the Olympics, a high school amputee is running in open competition on similar carbon-fiber blades. And once again, guidelines are gray, even nonexistent.

title: Snapchat Pornography to Test Advertisers Tolerance for Risk
description: One of the most powerful advertising-buying firms has been warning its clients about the risks of their corporate marketing inadvertently showing up next to pornography on Snapchat.

title: Republican Health Plan Could End Insurance Coverage of Abortion
description: The Republican proposal to replace the Affordable Care Act would bar people from using federal tax credits to buy health insurance plans that cover abortion.

title: Trumps Immigration Orders May Be Affecting Canada, U.S. Official Admits
description: OTTAWA  John F. Kelly, the American homeland security secretary, acknowledged on Friday that President Trumps executive orders on immigration and the perception that the United States was now inhospitable toward Muslims may be causing more migrants to seek refuge in Canada.

title: How Healthy Are You? G.O.P. Bill Would Help Employers Find Out
description: A bill in Congress could make it harder for workers to keep employers from getting access to their personal medical and genetic information and raise the financial penalties for those who opt out of workplace wellness programs.

title: Wealthy Would Get Billions in Tax Cuts Under Obamacare Repeal Plan
description: Two of the biggest tax cuts in Republican proposals to repeal the Affordable Care Act would deliver roughly $144 billion over the coming decade to those with incomes of $1 million or more, according to a congressional analysis.

title: Breaking Up With The Bachelor
description: Ive spent a lot of time since Nov. 8 wondering how Donald J. Trump happened, and whether any part of his vindictive, chaotic and xenophobic presidency might, in some small way, be my fault.

title: Pacification, Through the Barrel of a Gun
description: With 11,000 men killed and little to show for it, 1967, in retrospect, is remembered as a year of concern for the United States in the Vietnam War. But at the time, optimism reigned. The offensive operations by American military forces throughout 1966 had halted the gains of the Peoples Army of Vietnam and the Peoples Liberation Armed Forces (known to its enemies as the Viet Cong). Those gains, combined with mounting efforts to pacify the civilian population, seemed to point the way toward victory  if not in 1967, then soon after.

title: Quotation of the Day: Steady Job Gains Set Stage for Fed to Raise Key Rate
description: They may have been phony in the past, but its very real now.

title: Glad Tidings About the Three Faces of Donald Trump
description: Good news: the president seems pretty enthusiastic about bringing down drug prices. This is important both because drug prices are way too high and because positive reports out of Washington are so very, very rare.

title: Duke, Shrugging Off the Boos, Rallies to Beat North Carolina
description: For North Carolina fans visiting Brooklyn for the first time this week to attend the Atlantic Coast Conference tournament, the irritation of jumping over a slush puddle only to barely miss a subway train has not been nearly as bad as the sight of Dukes Grayson Allen.

title: Bernie Sanders: Trump Should Avoid a Bad Zika Deal
description: Donald J. Trump told the American people during his presidential campaign, This country is being drained of its jobs and its money because we have stupid people making bad deals. He promised to make better deals, ones in which we would win so much we may even get tired of winning.

title: Try to Win
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Natan Last is no stranger to word introduction, and part of this puzzles challenge was the admirable number of new crossword entries, especially in the acrosses. This was a puzzle I had (for schedule reasons) to start and finish in more than one sitting and I think the time away, to let the middle region of my brain make connections, helped me solve in general. I answered a few short down gimmes like LILO, SHAD, RUE and DATA, gave the whole grid a once-over, then left it alone for a day and a night, and when I came back several of the long answers popped into mind.

title: Trump Ends Silence With Palestinians, Opening a Path
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump spoke with President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority on Friday for the first time since taking office and invited him to visit the White House, opening a new avenue of diplomacy as he develops his own peace initiative for the Middle East.

title: Rugbys More Perfect Union
description: In Dublin next Saturday, Ireland and England will play the final game of the Six Nations Championship. Thousands of miles away, in an office in New York, I will follow every pass, kick, tackle, ruck and scrum.

title: Sue While the Conflicts Are Hot
description: The presidents son Eric probably said it best: I think our brand is the hottest it has ever been. No surprise there  nothing like a presidency to boost business. It is nevertheless shocking to see the brazenness of the ethical conflicts and watch the first family celebrate its good fortune.

title: What the Jobs Report Is Telling Mr. Trump
description: Wait a minute, didnt President Trump say he had inherited a mess? Yet there he was on Friday retweeting a Twitter post about the solid February jobs report. GREAT AGAIN:+235,000.

title: Henry Fowler concerned over two quarterbacks
description: Henry Fowler concerned over two quarterbacks

title: Anne Friedman Glauber, Champion of Social Causes, Dies at 63
description: Anne Friedman Glauber, who amplified her voice as a public relations executive to help prevent domestic violence, empower women in war-torn countries and support fellow patients of pancreatic cancer, died on Feb. 28 in Manhattan. She was 63.

title: Muhammad Ali Jr., Detained Last Month at Airport, Stopped Again
description: One day after Muhammad Ali Jr. spoke with members of Congress about being detained at a Florida airport last month, he was briefly stopped again before boarding a flight on Friday afternoon, his lawyer said.

title: A Biddle Jackson Fight
description: A Biddle-Jackson fight.

title: United States, With a Halting First Step, Chases Its First World Baseball Classic Title
description: MIAMI  As their opening game of the World Baseball Classic stretched into extra innings on Friday, the United States players faced an unsettling possibility. Starting with the top of the 11th at all W.B.C. games, every inning must begin with runners on first and second bases.

title: Why cant he wait?
description: Why cant he wait.

description: INTERNATIONAL

description: Hurt my pride
