Putting together a surprising coalition of alienated and frustrated voters, he won the White House over a Washington icon and claimed a mandate for swift and dramatic change.

title: The Image of Emmett Till
description: With all the controversy surrounding the painting of Emmett Tills mutilated remains at the Whitney Biennial, one important voice is missing from the dialogue. What would Mamie Till-Mobley, Emmetts mother, have to say about a white artists rendering of the iconic Jet magazine coffin photograph of her son, a 14-year-old African-American from Chicago who was lynched while visiting relatives in Mississippi in 1955?

title: U.S. Probably Had a Role in Mosul Deaths, Commander Says
description: WASHINGTON  The senior United States commander in Iraq said on Tuesday that an American airstrike most likely led to the collapse of a building in Mosul that killed scores of civilians this month.

title: What Were Reading
description: New York Times reporters and editors are highlighting great stories from around the web. You can receive What Were reading by email, and let us know how you like it at wwr@nytimes.com.

title: When You Know Its Love: A Slice of Bacon, and a Dancers Revelation
description: How do you know when you are in love? No 1-800-line psychic will tell you. No notice sent by registered mail. Not even a ping from your iPhone. But there are a million ways of figuring it out, and weve asked some people when they knew. Here is one way:

description: 1. Notice the steady sound of a sizzle when frying in a skillet; popping noises or uneven rhythms mean the heat is too high.

title: Mysterious Buyer of Trumps Childhood Home Said to Be From China
description: They first arrived in late January, caravans of black Escalades driving along a small street in Jamaica Estates, an upscale neighborhood in Queens, and stopping in front of a modest Tudor-style house that had just been sold at auction: the home where President Trump lived as a boy. Out stepped a stream of people in business suits, according to a neighbor, all speaking Chinese.

title: Right and Left: Partisan Writing You Shouldnt Miss
description: The political news cycle is fast, and keeping up can be overwhelming. Trying to find differing perspectives worth your time is even harder. Thats why we have scoured the internet for political writing from the right and left that you might not have seen.

title: Germany Refuses Turkeys Request to Spy on Opponents of Erdogan
description: BERLIN  German officials acknowledged on Tuesday that they had rebuffed a request by the Turkish government to spy on its opponents in Germany, the latest strain to relations as President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey pursues a referendum next month to expand his powers.

title: What You Should Watch Tuesday Night
description: BonesWhen to watch: 9:01 p.m., on Fox (series finale). Add it to your Watchlist.

title: A Ballerina and Choreographer Team Up to Be Goddesses
description: Yes, theyre both women and theyre both in the dance world. But thats where the similarity ends.

title: Review: Karl Marx City Revisits the Everyday Terror of Dictatorship
description: Karl Marx City, Michael Tucker and Petra Epperleins unsettling new documentary, is a smart, highly personal addition to the growing syllabus of distressingly relevant cautionary political tales. The volumes currently crowding bookstore front tables  George Orwells 1984, Sinclair Lewiss It Cant Happen Here, Hannah Arendts The Origins of Totalitarianism  offer time-tested prophecies and autopsies of dictatorship. Karl Marx City supplements their theories and speculations with everyday facts about life in the supposed workers paradise of the German Democratic Republic.

title: A Dance Troupe Adds Fresh Faces. The Youngest Is 66.
description: Keep the arms heavy, feel the weight of the step, the choreographer Larissa Velez-Jackson called to her performers, a group of women ages 66 to 87, as they practiced walking like runway models in a studio at New York Live Arts. Every few steps, they paused as if posing for a camera, throwing sultry glances toward the front of the room.

title: Chris Colfer: The First Time I Braved New York (and a Taxi!)
description: Imagine, if you will, the Pillsbury Doughboy with Peter Bradys haircut and Truman Capotes voice. Add a sprinkling of the fear of being touched and the social anxiety of a shy Chihuahua. That was me at 18, and in December 2008, that guy decided it was a good idea to take a trip to New York City all by himself.

title: Rotating Recipes at Chefs Club Counter in NoLIta
description: CHEFS CLUB COUNTER At this extension of Chefs Club, the NoLIta restaurant where chefs from around the globe are invited to cook, Stephane De Baets, the companys president and founder, is taking a new tack on fast-casual dining featuring a rotating roster of specialties from prominent chefs. We pay chefs a fee to use their recipes, and they get royalties for sales, he said. Mr. De Baets was not forthcoming on the financial details because not all the chefs are paid the same amount, though each is guaranteed a minimum. The recipes will be featured for around three months, then other chefs dishes will rotate in. The first round will feature breakfast sandwiches from Alvin Cailan of Eggslut in Los Angeles; a ham-and-cheese on baguette from Eric Kayser; a burger from Jean-Georges Vongerichten; and duck rice from George Mendess Aldea menu. Linton Hopkins from Atlanta will offer a grain bowl, and there will also be Roman-style pizza by Magnus Hansson. At the spacious restaurant, done in creamy tile with glove-leather upholstery, customers order food at a counter and get a buzzer alert when its ready. Beer and wine are served. Mr. De Baets is considering expanding to other locations. (Opens Friday): 62 Spring Street (Lafayette Street), 646-438-9172, chefsclubcounter.com.

title: At BlackRock, Machines Are Rising Over Managers to Pick Stocks
description: Score one for the machines.

title: Review: In Chess Match No. 5, the Words of John Cage, Deconstructed
description: For decades, Marcel Duchamp was busy conspicuously playing chess, not visibly doing art. Much the same happens in Chess Match No. 5, which quotes that remark by the composer John Cage about the conceptualist. The two people onstage are conspicuously playing chess; they also make toast, fiddle with a radio, drink tea and trade disconnected aphorisms and anecdotes. They are not visibly doing theater, if that means plot, traditional characters or singing cats.

title: Review: Name-Dropping Nobodies Hoping for Showbiz Success
description: In a crowded television landscape, pity the show that is decently executed but not blazingly original enough to excite. Comedy has had a run of those lately  the HBO series Crashing, for instance, and the Seeso therapist satire Shrink.

title: Mosul, Devin Nunes, Nicola Sturgeon: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: 5 Brands Creating Streetwear for Women
description: The brothers Jacob and Axel Hagg moved to Los Angeles from New York in 2012  and a year later, they launched their brand, Brashy Studios. There was and is a creative opportunity in creating a new womens streetwear line not present in the mens market, says Jacob, who first moved from Stockholm to New York to intern for a creative agency before decamping to the West Coast. The brothers draw inspiration from the deep corners of the internet  as well as from people they find on Instagram, like the musical artist Tommy Genesis, an underground female rapper known for her rebellious attitude and lyrics. Though Brashy is geared toward female customers, some pieces in the collection  such as oversize hoodies, boxy jackets and roomy trousers  are intentionally gender-fluid. For us, streetwear should incorporate something of an anti-establishment ethos; establishment can of course be freely interpreted, Jacob says. The brands spring/summer 2017 collection  which is available now at Colette in Paris and on the Brashy Studios website  consists of a fluorescent-pink vinyl jacket and pants, a tearaway tracksuit and pieces emblazoned with the word GIRLS.

title: Romeo (and Juliet), How Many Art Thou? 1 Ballet Score, Many Stagings
description: This week, the Joffrey Ballet, which left New York for Chicago in 1995, returns to this city: It brings Romeo & Juliet  choreographed by Krzysztof Pastor to the Prokofiev score  with a difference. Here, the story is told through the sequence of 20th-century Italian politics. The first act is set during Mussolinis regime in the 1930s, the second act in the relatively prosperous 1950s, the third in the 1990s. Nonetheless, the central characters are still called Romeo, Juliet, Mercutio, Tybalt and so on. Chicagoans have admired this Romeo; New York sees it for the first time this week.

title: Congress Moves to Overturn Obama-Era Online Privacy Rules
description: WASHINGTON  Congress completed its overturning of the nations strongest internet privacy protections for individuals on Tuesday in a victory for telecommunications companies, which can track and sell a customers online information with greater ease.

title: Vision Zero Has Made Ocean Parkway Safer, but Some See Red
description: Standing a safe distance back from the traffic rolling down Ocean Parkway in Brooklyn, Betty Smith, cane in hand, waited at noon on Monday for the Beverley Road light to change. She was discussing the speed limit on the parkway, which a state senator wants to boost to 30 miles per hour from the current 25. I think the traffic moves pretty well now, she said. Just then, like a log hurtling down a flume, the wheels of a car skirting the curb picked up a puddle of slush-melt and sent it jetting toward Ms. Smith. She took a step back and finished her thought.

title: A Dearth of I.P.O.s, but Its Not the Fault of Red Tape
description: The confirmation hearing last week for Jay Clayton, who has been nominated to head the Securities and Exchange Commission, focused on the continued sluggishness of the market for initial public offerings. Senators pushed the nominee to do something, anything, to revive it.

title: Cloud of Uncertainty Envelops Joakim Noahs Suspension
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Joakim Noah returned to the court Tuesday afternoon, donning a Knicks workout jersey and shuffling through a light practice at the teams training facility. The timing and the significance of the scene were not immaterial.

title: Cosbys Lawyers Want to Keep Quaaludes Testimony From Trial
description: Lawyers for Bill Cosby asked a Pennsylvania judge on Tuesday to exclude from his sexual assault trial the entertainers deposition testimony from a 12-year-old civil suit in which he acknowledged that he obtained quaaludes as part of his efforts to have sex with women.

title: A Florida of Sun, Sky, Sea and Mind
description: GULFThe Making of an American SeaBy Jack E. DavisIllustrated. 592 pages. Liveright. $29.95.

title: Ex-Christie Allies Face Sentencing for Roles in Bridge Scandal
description: Two former allies of Gov. Chris Christie are scheduled to be sentenced on Wednesday for their roles in a scheme to close access lanes to the George Washington Bridge as political payback against a New Jersey mayor who declined to endorse Mr. Christies re-election.

title: Scotland Votes to Demand a Post-Brexit Independence Referendum
description: LONDON  Only hours before Britain is to embark on its momentous journey out of the European Union, Scotlands Parliament on Tuesday underscored one of the risks along that path by voting to demand a new referendum on Scottish independence.

title: Coal Miners Hope Trumps Order Will Help. But Few Are Counting on It.
description: Eddie Mounts, the son and grandson of miners, describes the past few years in coal country as a time of economic plague. Businesses closed and people scattered, he said. They went to Tennessee, North Carolina, anywhere work could be found. If they had to learn a new trade, they did that, too.

title: Joe Girardi Trots Out a New Look for the Yankees
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The lineup the Yankees trotted out Tuesday night for an exhibition game against the Detroit Tigers did not look like anything that Manager Joe Girardi penciled in last season.

title: Its Darwin, Not Stalin
description: Dear Diary:

title: F.B.I. Arrests Iraqi Refugees Related to Americans Kidnapper
description: WASHINGTON  The F.B.I. on Tuesday arrested  two Iraqi refugees living in Northern Virginia after they failed to disclose that one of their brothers had been involved in the 2004 kidnapping of an American contractor in Iraq.

title: Carlos the Jackal Receives a Third Life Sentence in France
description: PARIS  The international terrorist and self-professed Marxist revolutionary known as Carlos the Jackal received a life sentence  his third  on Tuesday for a 1974 attack on a Paris drugstore that killed two people and wounded 34.

title: Congress Is Headed to Another Government Funding Showdown
description: WASHINGTON  Ten legislative days before funding would run out, Congress is heading toward another government shutdown showdown. Democrats and many Republicans are likely to refuse to go along with President Trumps request for money for a border wall financed in part by outsize cuts to medical research. And the specter of another fight over Planned Parenthood funding is also in the offing.

title: Policy Shift Helps Coal, but Other Forces May Limit Effect
description: Many fossil fuel executives are celebrating President Trumps move to dismantle the Obama administrations Clean Power Plan. But their cheers are muted, because market forces and state initiatives continue to elevate coals rivals, especially natural gas and renewable energy.

title: A Surprise Trip to Prison
description: Campbell Robertson had nearly finished his reporting on St. Clair Correctional Facility in Springville, Ala., before he took a single step inside the prison  a place that had, in recent years, been one of the most violent in a state system known for its violence, as described in an article published today.

title: U.S. Womens Team Strikes a Deal With U.S.A. Hockey
description: Meghan Duggan understood the risk. So did her 22 teammates on the United States womens national hockey team. They put their careers on the line when they announced March 15 that they would boycott the coming world championship if U.S.A. Hockey, the sports national governing body, did not increase wages and support for the women.

title: Bastian Schweinsteiger, Trading Manchester United for M.L.S., Maintains His Drive
description: Early Tuesday afternoon, Bastian Schweinsteiger and his wife, the retired tennis star Ana Ivanovic, boarded a Lufthansa flight in Munich, bound for Chicago. On Wednesday, Schweinsteiger will be presented as a Chicago Fire player. By Saturday, fitness permitting, he may well have made his debut for the Fire in Major League Soccer. It is a breathless, whirlwind week  the hectic schedule of a man making up for lost time.

title: Bill Minor, Journalist Who Was Called Conscience of Mississippi, Dies at 94
description: Bill Minor, whose courageous reporting helped open Americans eyes to everyday racial discrimination in the South in the 1960s and won him recognition as the conscience of Mississippi, died on Tuesday in Ridgeland, Miss., outside Jackson. He was 94.

title: President Trump Risks the Planet
description: That didnt take long.

title: Amid White House Tumult, Pence Offers Trump a Steady Hand
description: WASHINGTON  When some of President Trumps aides were reassuring him over the past few weeks that he had enough votes to pass a health care bill, Vice President Mike Pence was skeptical.

title: Quotation of the Day: Filling Void, Pence Guides Boss in Battle
description: He is an honorable man. He is a Christian man. But theres going to come a time when the Trump storm is over, and you have spent all this time defending him and repeating the stuff Trump has said.

title: Fact Check: Trumps Misleading Words on Energy and Jobs
description: WASHINGTON  In his first major move to undo President Barack Obamas climate change policies, President Trump declared Tuesday the beginning of a new era in American energy and production and job creation.

title: Judge Seeks to Clarify Rudy Giulianis Role on Gold Traders Team
description: When it was disclosed this week that a Turkish gold trader jailed in Manhattan and charged with violating United States sanctions on Iran had expanded his legal team to include the former New York mayor, Rudolph W. Giuliani, and a second prominent lawyer, the moves raised questions, even with the judge in the case.

title: With Raiders Move, N.F.L. Owners Go Where the Money Is
description: Not long after the owner Mark Davis of the Raiders got the green light from the other owners of N.F.L. teams to leave Oakland and move to Las Vegas, he sought to make things right with the passionate, sometimes rancorous hometown fans.

title: As Federal Cuts Loom, New York State Aims to Protect Itself From Washington
description: ALBANY  The agonies of budget season in Albany are all too evident: marathon negotiations and legislative sessions running all night; bills debated, batted around beyond recognition and often left for dead; and the hopes of millions of constituents raised and dashed in the course of an hour.

title: Crisis Time
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  In general, there is a myth that adults are wont to suffer from midlife crises at some point in their lives but, given the extraordinary medical advancements we have seen, middle age is a concept with moving goal posts, to say the least.

title: 2 Black Women Sue Fox News, Claiming Racial Discrimination
description: Fox News, whose chairman, Roger Ailes, was ousted last year after a string of sexual harassment claims, is facing new allegations of discrimination.

title: F.D.A. Approves First Drug to Treat Severe Multiple Sclerosis
description: The Food and Drug Administration approved on Tuesday the first drug to treat a severe form of multiple sclerosis, offering hope to patients who previously had no other options to combat a relentless disease that leads to paralysis and cognitive decline.

title: Like Trump, White House Staff Will Skip Correspondents Dinner

description: There was no action in this weeks episode of The Americans. I mean that literally: In a week with no murders or chases, the most active scene consisted of Paiges walking around Pastor Tims house. And I mean it more figuratively: In a week when the focus was on sex, no one was getting any.

title: Five Places to Go in Helsinki
description: In design-centric Helsinki, Teurastamos red-brick buildings once housed slaughtered reindeers, pigs and cows. Today, this meatpacking district has transformed into an epicenter for the citys creative class. Everyone from trendy millennials and stylish moms pushing strollers to Finnish bureaucrats have taken to perusing the shops highlighting Finnish-made products, eating at the many eclectic restaurants and frequenting the indie and electronic music festivals held there. Getting to the neighborhood just got easier too with EkoRent, a Zipcar-like start-up with a fleet of electric cars and parking and charging stations.

title: Designer Tom Dixon Unveils His Secret Project With Ikea

title: Ex-Congressman From Texas Charged With Stealing Charitable Donations
description: A former United States representative from Texas and one of his aides were indicted on Tuesday on charges that they stole hundreds of thousands of dollars meant for charity, some of which was used to illegally finance his campaigns.

description: PANAMA CITY  In an emphatic destruction of Honduras on Friday, the United States mens soccer team seemed to glide effortlessly across the field in almost dreamlike fashion, producing six goals and 3 critical points that moved them closer to their goal of qualifying for the 2018 World Cup.

title: The Supreme Court Keeps Tinkering With Death
description: Its been more than two decades since Justice Harry Blackmun renounced the death penalty, calling it a failed experiment and writing that I no longer shall tinker with the machinery of death. By refusing to stop the use of capital punishment, the Supreme Court has consigned itself to tinkering with the death machine, trying in vain to make a barbaric, irrational system appear predictable and just.

title: How the Republicans Sold Your Privacy to Internet Providers
description: On Tuesday afternoon, while most people were focused on the latest news from the House Intelligence Committee, the House quietly voted to undo rules that keep internet service providers  the companies like Comcast, Verizon and Charter that you pay for online access  from selling your personal information.

description: Republicans just made clear how little they care about protecting the privacy of Americans by letting companies like Verizon and Comcast sell advertisers the internet browsing histories and other personal data of their customers without getting permission. The move could bolster the profits of the telecommunications industry by billions of dollars.

title: Trump Is a Chinese Agent
description: The big story everyone is chasing is whether President Trump is a Russian stooge. Wrong. Thats all a smoke screen. Trump is actually a Chinese agent. He is clearly out to make China great again. Just look at the facts.

title: China Poised to Take Lead on Climate After Trumps Move to Undo Policies

title: Phillipa Soo Doesnt Leave It All Onstage

Now youre starring in a Broadway musical adaptation of Amlie. You graduated from Juilliard in 2012  what does all of this feel like? Theres the cool factor, right? You see your face on a sign or your name on something, like: Ahh! Here I am! And then theres a huge responsibility and the scary part of it, which is like, Now what happens? And then you realize, Oh, yeah, this is my job.

title: How Well Do You Sleep?

title: Those Indecipherable Medical Bills? Theyre One Reason Health Care Costs So Much
description: The catastrophe struck Wanda Wickizer on Christmas Day 2013. A generally healthy, energetic 51-year-old, she suddenly found herself vomiting all day, racked with debilitating headaches. When her alarmed teenage son called an ambulance, the paramedics thought that she had food poisoning and didnt take her to the emergency room. Later, when she became confused and groggy at 3 a.m., her boyfriend raced her to Sentara Norfolk General Hospital in coastal Virginia, where a scan showed she was suffering from a subarachnoid hemorrhage. A vessel had burst, and blood was leaking into the narrow space between the skull and the brain.

title: My Friend Is Bankrupting Herself. Should I Speak Up?
description: Ive been friends with Cindy for 15 years. Shes in her early 60s and never married. Because of job stress, she took early retirement and lives on a reduced pension. Despite not having a lot of money, she is generous, spoiling her family and friends with gifts.

title: In School Nurses Room: Tylenol, Bandages and an Antidote to Heroin

Trumps presidential campaign staff and the Russian government, perhaps even influencing the 2016 election.

It wasnt long after the Michigan mens basketball team won the Big Ten tournament this month when the moment arrived for the Wolverines to claim their polyester scalp: to bring out the ladders and let each player, coach and staff member take part in cutting down the nets.

title: In Kansas City, Barbecue, Beer and Bargains
description: I had just learned my first lesson of Kansas City barbecue the hard way: Dont just waltz right in at closing time expecting to be served. In my defense, I was coming pretty much directly from Kansas City International Airport, where I had landed on a Saturday night. I checked into my hotel, on the downtown Missouri side, and quickly crossed olkayser to Kansas to Slaps BBQ, which I had heard good things about. And while I arrived well before closing time, a sign greeted my arrival that clearly stated that they were open until 8 p.m.  or when they sold out, whichever came first. It had come first. I slunk back to Missouri.

Khalila Archer, program director at Inward Bound Mindfulness Education.

One hundred miles east of Manhattan, the maritime village on the North Fork of Long Island was once a whaling port and the oyster-producing capital of New York, according to Mike Osinski, an owner of Widows Hole Oyster Company. The underwater farm he runs with his wife, Isabel, is an eight-minute walk from the Greenport train station and open for tours and tastings.

title: The Art of a Deal With the Taliban

Only the conflict in Vietnam lasted longer. United States troops have been in Afghanistan since October 2001 as part of a force that peaked at nearly 140,000 troops (of which about 100,000 were American) and is estimated to have cost the taxpayers at least $783 billion.

title: How to Make a Deal With North Korea

Yet South Koreans would bear the brunt of the retaliation should Mr. Trump opt for a pre-emptive strike against the North Korean regime. Long-term peace on the Korean Peninsula is impossible without Seouls input.

title: Turkeys Dangerous Path Away From Democracy

He has exploited a conflict with Kurdish insurgents and a failed coup to win elections and wage a brutal crackdown on critics, and now he is picking a fight with Europe to rally support for a referendum next month on constitutional changes that would essentially give him unfettered power. The tactic might get him some votes, but like the powers he seeks, it has dangerous consequences for Turkeys future.

title: Oscars Error Wont Cost Accounting Firm Its Job
description: The spectacular best picture mix-up at this years Oscars was a humiliating moment for the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, the presenters Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway, and especially the accounting firm PwC  but it will not cost the firm its prized client.

title: How to Do Seated Half Spinal Twist Pose
description: This twisting pose can increase the flexibility in your back, while stretching the shoulders, hips and chest. It can also help relieve tension in the middle of your back.

title: How to Do Childs Pose in Yoga
description: This calming pose is a good default pause position. You can use childs pose to rest and refocus before continuing to your next pose. It gently stretches your lower back, hips, thighs, knees and ankles and relaxes your spine, shoulders and neck.

title: Justices Dig Through 1984 Murder, Weighing Withheld Evidence
description: WASHINGTON  At an unusual Supreme Court argument on Wednesday, the justices tried to sort out who was responsible for a notorious 1984 murder in Washington.

title: How to Do Four Limbed Staff Pose
description: This push-up variation follows plank pose in a common yoga sequence known as the sun salutation. It is a good pose to learn if you want to eventually work on more advanced poses, such as arm balances or inversions.

title: How to Do The Downward-Facing Dog Pose in Yoga
description: Downward-facing dog strengthens the arms, shoulders and back while stretching the hamstrings, calves and arches of your feet. It can also help relieve back pain.

title: Demand for Ivory Drops, and Elephants Benefit
description: The price of ivory has dropped by more than half in the past three years. This decline may be good news for elephants that have been targeted for their tusks.

title: Senate Intelligence Committee Leaders Vow Thorough Russian Investigation
description: WASHINGTON  Senators leading the investigation into Russian interference in the November election pledged on Wednesday to conduct an aggressive inquiry, including an examination of any ties to President Trump, as they sought to distance themselves from the flagging efforts in the House.

title: The Prettiest Restaurant Plates in Paris
description: Meet the ceramists making beautiful dishes for some of the citys chicest restaurants.

title: Little Sign of a Trump Bump in the Economic Forecast
description: Consumers are more confident. Stocks are up 5 percent since the start of the year. And from the president on down, theres talk of a Trump bump.

title: How to Do a Side Plank
description: You can work the sides of your core when you rotate a plank to your side.

title: How to Do a Dolphin Push-up
description: Build all-over strength with this yoga pose.

title: Look for Market Buoyancy Ahead of Brexit to Be Short-Lived
description: Divorce can be messy, even when both sides start out wanting an amicable settlement. Brexit may well work the same way now that Prime Minister Theresa May has started the process for Britains exit from the European Union.

title: Rob Roth Previews the Black Party, a Night to Let Go of Your Inhibitions
description: This Saturday night, thousands of gay men will don leather outfits or the skimpiest of black accessories to dance at a club on the Far West Side of Manhattan for a 20-hour marathon event known for its erotically daring stage shows, theatrical acrobatic acts and otherworldly lighting.

title: How to Do a Warrior 2 Pose in Yoga
description: Feel strong and balanced in this pose.

title: How to Do a Standing Lunge Dip Sequence in Yoga
description: Heres a lunge for yogis.

title: Valeant Bet Was a Huge Mistake, Hedge Fund Chief Ackman Says
description: It is rare that William A. Ackman, the brash activist investor, apologizes for anything. As a successful hedge fund manager, Mr. Ackman has made billions of dollars for himself and his investors with bold and counterintuitive bets.

title: How to Do an Airplane Dip Sequence in Yoga
description: This pose will require focus, balance and all-over strength.

title: Aimee Mann Traces Elegant Despair on Mental Illness
description: Extremism rarely sounds as decorous as it does on Mental Illness, Aimee Manns first solo album in five years. Since her arrival in the 1980s as the singer and lyricist in Til Tuesday, and through her solo albums, the finely self-aware Ms. Mann has written a catalog full of tuneful, disillusioned, verbally nuanced midtempo songs that she delivers in her glumly levelheaded voice  among them the Academy Award-nominated Save Me from the 1999 film Magnolia. After a swerve toward rowdier, pushier rock on the 2014 album she made with Ted Leo in a duo called the Both, she doubles down on both the quiet and the desperation on Mental Illness. Instead of worrying about stereotyping herself, she exults in it.

title: When Love and Travel Intersect: Your Stories
description: The Times Travel section is looking for your stories about when love and travel meet.

title: Grab Your Wallets. Spring Is Bringing New Shops.
description: On Thursday, Dr. Martens will open a new store in Herald Square that will feature updates on the companys classic lug-sole boots, like a summer-weight style with a cutaway heel in metallic patent leather ($110). At 1133 Broadway.

title: How to Do Crow Pose in Yoga
description: Feel like youre flying with this upper-body building pose.

title: How to Do Side Crow Pose in Yoga
description: Fly on your side with this challenging pose.

title: How to do a Half Handstand in Yoga
description: All the benefits of a full handstand, with the help of a wall.

title: How to Do a Full Handstand in Yoga
description: A pose that will truly help you see the world in a new way.

title: Plays About the Art World? Not Sold
description: When the art market bubbled in the late 1980s, playwrights took notice  and wrote such works as Donald Marguliess Sight Unseen (1991) which orbits around a hyped-up painter, and Yasmina Rezas Art (1994), set amid the Paris collecting class. Yet even when compared to the go-go 1980s, the last 15 years have been transformative for the art market, with ever higher prices for at least a subset of modern and contemporary painting and sculpture. (Though look out: A market corrections underway.)

title: How to Do a Full Headstand in Yoga
description: Turn everything upside down with this challenging yoga pose.

title: Richard Nixon, Portrait of a Thin-Skinned, Media-Hating President
description: RICHARD NIXONThe LifeBy John A. FarrellIllustrated. 737 pages. Doubleday. $35.

title: What You Should Watch Wednesday Night
description: HarlotsWhen to watch: Now, on Hulu (series premiere).Add it to your Watchlist.

title: Jerzy Kosinski Stars in a Novel About His Own Strange Life
description: JERZY By Jerome Charyn 237 pp. Bellevue Literary Press. Paper, $16.99.

title: Review: In When Its You, a Narrator Recalls the Killer in a Mass Shooting
description: Ginnifer hasnt had many boyfriends, and frankly the last one was a creep. But the first? A boy named Jason Hanley back in high school? For two decades, shes remembered him fondly. When her mom died a few years ago, he came to the funeral and brought a Key lime pie.

title: Brexit, Chris Christie, Ivanka Trump: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: In AMCs Western The Son, the Novelist Philipp Meyer Lassoes TV
description: DRIFTWOOD, Tex.  On a blistering day last August, the novelist Philipp Meyer was at a cattle ranch in the grassy Hill Country of Central Texas, standing in a field that had been turned into a replica of a Comanche camp.

title: Texas TV: From the Sublime to the Ridiculous
description: The latest entry in the booming genre of Texas-based TV is The Son, an AMC drama based on the captivating historical novel of the same title, which sounds promising. It stars as its Texan patriarch the very Irish Pierce Brosnan, which does not.

title: Review: A Shameful Story Gets Its Due in Time: The Kalief Browder Story
description: Spike, the home of Lip Sync Battle and Ink Masters, is perhaps not the type of channel where youd expect to find one of the seasons most significant docu-series. Yet Time: The Kalief Browder Story is just that.

title: Review, a Workaholics Slapstick Tragedy Nears Its End
description: Review, on Comedy Central, is one of televisions funniest comedies and darkest tragedies, for the same reason.

title: Sometimes, Spending Brings a Bigger Return Than Saving
description: Life experiences give you an incalculable return on investment. Every. Single. Time. So why is it so hard for us to spend money on them?

title: Nikki Haley Calls United Nations Human Rights Council So Corrupt
description: UNITED NATIONS  The American envoy to the United Nations, Nikki R. Haley, described the United States on Wednesday as the moral conscience of the world, and she dismissed the United Nations Human Rights Council as so corrupt without offering evidence.

title: Review: In The Zookeepers Wife, the Holocaust Seems Tame
description: Schindlers List With Pets: Thats my suggested alternate title for The Zookeepers Wife. This mild-mannered Holocaust film probably wasnt conceived as family fare but is so timid and sanitized it almost feels safe for children.

title: Review: The Discovery of an Afterlife, Then the Suicides
description: What if lifes greatest mystery were solved? How would the world react? The Discovery, a star-laden film with simultaneous theatrical and Netflix releases on Friday, begins with that earthshaking premise but then turns small, a shift that leaves you feeling as if youve seen only half the movie.

title: 8 New Books We Recommend This Week
description: Devotees of Elena Ferrante should check out the latest piece in the puzzle of her identity: a novel by Domenico Starnone, Ties, that offers a response to her early work Days of Abandonment. Bonus: Ties is translated from the Italian by the Pulitzer Prize winner Jhumpa Lahiri, who also provides a captivating introduction. Two nonfiction books tackle the timely issue of inequality: one from the point of view of constitutional governance, the other from the perspective of your dental health. Philatelists and oenophiles, weve got you covered: The One-Cent Magenta tracks the travels of the most valuable stamp in the world, while Cork Dork chronicles the oft-hungover adventures of a would-be sommelier (and pairs nicely with something sweet).

title: Rex Tillerson to Lift Human Rights Conditions on Arms Sale to Bahrain
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson has decided to lift all human rights conditions on a major sale of F-16 fighter jets and other arms to Bahrain in an effort to end a rift between the United States and a critical Middle East ally, according to administration and congressional officials involved in the debate.

title: William McPherson, Book Critic and Novelist, Dies at 84
description: William McPherson, a novelist and Pulitzer Prize-winning book critic for The Washington Post who won late-life acclaim for a rueful essay describing his descent into poverty, died on Tuesday in Washington. He was 84.

title: Betsy DeVos Calls for More School Choice, Saying Money Isnt the Answer
description: WASHINGTON  Betsy DeVos, in her first extended policy address as education secretary, argued on Wednesday for an expansion of school choice programs, pointing to lagging test scores and a program championed by the Obama administration that funneled billions into low-performing schools but failed to produce better academic outcomes.

title: After-School Coach Charged With Sexual Abuse of 8-Year-Old Girls
description: An after-school basketball coach was charged in New York State Supreme Court on Wednesday with sexually abusing two 8-year-old girls while working at a Manhattan school, prosecutors said.

title: State Department Worker Is Accused of Hiding Ties to China
description: WASHINGTON  The F.B.I. has arrested a veteran State Department employee who concealed her extensive contacts with Chinese intelligence agents, who for years lavished her with thousands of dollars in gifts, prosecutors announced Wednesday.

title: Review: In Czanne et Moi, Zola and the Artist Are Pals. However ...
description: With you I never know if Im dealing with a dog, a cobra or a butterfly, the writer mile Zola (portrayed by Guillaume Canet) says out of frustration and impatience to the Post-Impressionist painter Paul Czanne (Guillaume Gallienne) in Czanne et Moi.

title: William Powell, Anarchist Cookbook Writer, Dies at 66
description: William Powell was a teenager, angry at the government and the Vietnam War, when he walked into the main branch of the New York Public Library in Manhattan in 1969 to begin research for a handbook on causing violent mayhem.

title: Power Must Be Taken: Excerpts From The Anarchist Cookbook
description: In 1971, William Powell published The Anarchist Cookbook, a collection of recipes for drugs, weapons, bombs and other forms of mayhem. He saw the book as a manifesto and guide for would-be revolutionaries, while the authorities saw it as a potential threat; the Federal Bureau of Investigation maintained files on the book for years.

title: With Opening Day Near, the Yankees Have Decisions to Make
description: DUNEDIN, Fla.  There was little enthralling about the Yankees 3-1 victory over the Toronto Blue Jays on a scorching Wednesday afternoon. Far more intriguing were meetings that the Yankees coaching staff, scouts and management were set to have upon returning to their headquarters in Tampa.

title: Hungary Plan That Could Shutter Soross University Is Called Political Vandalism
description: LONDON  A law put forward by the Hungarian government would force a university founded by the Hungarian-American financier and philanthropist George Soros to shut its doors, the schools top official said on Wednesday.

title: Looking for a Lost Child on the Train
description: Dear Diary:

title: Arthur Blythe, Jazz Saxophonist Who Mixed Sultry and Strident, Dies at 76
description: Arthur Blythe, whose brawny alto saxophone sound and independent spirit made him a standard-bearer of the New York jazz avant-garde in the late 1970s, died on Monday at a retirement home in Lancaster, Calif. He was 76.

title: Chase Had Ads on 400,000 Sites. Then on Just 5,000. Same Results.
description: As of a few weeks ago, advertisements for JPMorgan Chase were appearing on about 400,000 websites a month. It is the sort of eye-popping number that has become the norm these days for big companies that use automated tools to reach consumers online.

title: Ignoring Diplomacys Past and Its Future Promise
description: One of Americas greatest contributions to international peace resulted from a historic investment in foreign aid. After defeating Fascism in World War II, Washington channeled billions of dollars into the war-torn nations of Europe and Japan, helping transform them into economic success stories and vital democratic allies.

title: Stepping Out, Melania Trump Honors Women Affected by Bias and Abuse
description: WASHINGTON  Melania Trump has been a spectral presence since her husband became president. But on Wednesday, the first lady stepped out of the shadows, speaking out on behalf of women who battle gender discrimination and violence around the world.

title: 13 Killed in Texas as Church Bus and Pickup Truck Collide
description: Thirteen people who were on their way home from a church retreat in southwest Texas were killed Wednesday afternoon when their bus collided head-on with a pickup truck, officials said.

title: Top Amateur Picks College Over L.P.G.A. Qualifying School
description: CHANDLER, Ariz.  Hannah OSullivan dipped her toe in professional golf, and the next thing she knew she was being carried by a swift current away from college and toward the L.P.G.A.

title: Quotation of the Day: As Trump Backtracks, China Seizes Chance to Lead on Climate
description: China wants to take over the role of the U.S. as a climate leader, and theyve baked it into their five-year plans.

title: Anti-Abortion Activists Charged in Planned Parenthood Video Case
description: California prosecutors filed felony charges on Tuesday against two anti-abortion activists who secretly recorded videos in an attempt to discredit abortion providers, saying that some of the recordings violated the states privacy law.

title: Crisis Upon Crisis in Venezuela
description: Venezuela was once one of Latin Americas economic powerhouses and a regional diplomatic heavyweight. To grasp how precipitously its global standing has eroded under President Nicols Maduro, consider these two recent developments.

title: Ivanka Trump: Assistant to the President
description: Ivanka Trump had security clearance and a West Wing office, but no official job titleuntil March, when she took on a formal role as an unpaid employee.

title: Meeting in Turkey With Erdogan May Be Tillersons Toughest
description: ANKARA, Turkey  He has already met the Mexican and Chinese presidents and hosted a conclave of 68 nations fighting the Islamic State, but no meeting in Rex W. Tillersons brief tenure as secretary of state will be as delicate as the one in Ankara on Thursday with Turkeys president, Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

title: Joakim Noahs Suspension Starts as Knicks Are Eliminated From Playoffs
description: Joakim Noah is an active member of the Knicks again, which means he is healthy enough to sit out the rest of this season.

title: U.S. War Footprint Grows in Middle East, With No Endgame in Sight
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The United States launched more airstrikes in Yemen this month than during all of last year. In Syria, it has airlifted local forces to front-line positions and has been accused of killing civilians in airstrikes. In Iraq, American troops and aircraft are central in supporting an urban offensive in Mosul, where airstrikes killed scores of people on March 17.

title: Googles Claim Against Former Executive Could Help Uber in Driverless-Car Lawsuit
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Several months before filing a lawsuit against Uber, Google demanded arbitration against the head of Ubers self-driving car unit, claiming that he used confidential salary information while trying to poach former colleagues to a new venture that he eventually sold to Uber.

title: Coal Mining Jobs Trump Would Bring Back No Longer Exist
description: In Decatur, Ill., far from the coal mines of Appalachia, Caterpillar engineers are working on the future of mining: mammoth haul trucks that drive themselves.

title: El Salvador, Prizing Water Over Gold, Bans All Metal Mining
description: SAN SALVADOR  Lawmakers in El Salvador voted overwhelmingly on Wednesday to prohibit all mining for gold and other metals, making the country the first in the world to impose a nationwide ban on metal mining, environmental activists said.

title: De Blasio Stymied in Attempt to Pay Legal Fees With Donations
description: Cleared in state and federal investigations into his administration, Mayor Bill de Blasio is now facing a new hurdle stemming from the inquiries into his fund-raising practices: how to pay the outstanding personal legal fees he has racked up over the last year.

title: Dramatic Ending
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  The revealer in todays crossword by Lewis Rothlein has been in the lexicon long enough for most people to know that when one performs a MIC DROP, they have revealed something particularly impressive and then they peace out, in popular parlance.

title: Sex Abuse Trial of Foster Father Paints His Home as a Prison
description: RIVERHEAD, N.Y.  The trial of a Long Island foster father accused of sexually abusing numerous children in his care began on Wednesday, as prosecutors described how his outwardly tranquil home  with its manicured lawn and classic cars parked in the driveway  was like a prison inside for the boys he was raising, many of whom suffered from mental illness or had low I.Q.s.

title: E.P.A. Chief, Rejecting Agencys Science, Chooses Not to Ban Insecticide
description: WASHINGTON  Scott Pruitt, the head of the Environmental Protection Agency, moved late on Wednesday to reject the scientific conclusion of the agencys own chemical safety experts who under the Obama administration recommended that one of the nations most widely used insecticides be permanently banned at farms nationwide because of the harm it potentially causes children and farm workers.

title: North Carolina Strikes a Deal to Repeal Restrictive Bathroom Law
description: ATLANTA  North Carolinas Republican-controlled legislature and its Democratic governor announced late Wednesday that they had reached an agreement to repeal the controversial state law that curbs legal protections for lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people and sets rules that affect transgender bathroom use in public buildings.

title: Legion, Season 1 Finale: The Dork Side of the Moon
description: Dont be afraid to care, advises the Pink Floyd singer-guitarist David Gilmour in the prog-rock titans dreamy anthem Breathe. Its a signature track on The Dark Side of the Moon, the perpetually best-selling concept album about modern life and mental illness that has soundtracked many a dorm-room bull session and chemically enhanced Wizard of Oz screening.

title: With Hair Bows and Chores, YouTube Youth Take On Mean Girls
description: Thirteen-year-old JoJo Siwa rolled up to school in a souped-up vintage car with a giant pink bow plastered on the grill. Inside the car, with her blond hair tightly pulled into a side ponytail and wrapped in a pastel yellow bow, she sang to her mother, I dont really care about what they say, while a group of mean girls wearing not-so-pastel clothes snickered from a bench. (We know theyre mean girls because the words mean girls are displayed on the screen next to them.)

title: An Unassuming Tokyo Enclave Is Having Its Moment
description: On a recent weeknight at Ahiru Store, a gastro wine bar in the Tomigaya neighborhood of Tokyo, the seven guests lucky enough to grab a spot at the counter noshed on dishes like freshly made pt, French-style onion pie, avocado and octopus salad, and what might be best described as a pan-fried take on shrimp tempura. Behind these diners, Japanese salarymen and expats in business attire crowded over two oak barrels serving as standing tables.

title: The Road to Nowhere
description: People seeking safety from Boko Haram  many of them women and children  are living along a highway in Niger, struggling to survive.

title: Beginning Brexit and Bracing for Impact
description: LONDON  The world did not end. No recession unfolded. Nine months after Britain voted to leave the European Union, disregarding warnings of grim economic consequences, a nation famous for calmly carrying on has seemingly gone about its business.

title: Brexit, Samsung, Turkey: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Fleeing Boko Haram, Thousands Cling to a Road to Nowhere
description: Times journalists spent weeks documenting the stories of people living along a desert highway in Niger, interviewing more than 100 residents scattered by Boko Haram.

title: Park Geun-hye, South Koreas Ousted Leader, Is Arrested and Jailed to Await Trial
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South Koreas recently impeached president, Park Geun-hye, was arrested on Friday, becoming the first South Korean leader to be put behind bars since the mid 1990s, when two former military dictators were imprisoned on corruption and mutiny charges.

title: Corrections: March 30, 2017
description: NEW YORK

title: Foreign Correspondents as They Live and Breathe
description: Times Insider shares insights into how we work at The New York Times. In this article, Didi Kirsten Tatlow, a Beijing-based Times correspondent, compares notes and guilt trips with Times reporters around the world who have moved with their families to smog-laden news hubs.

title: Whats on TV Thursday: The Amazing Race and Some Beachy Diversions
description: The Amazing Race throws caution to the wind in its new season. This Old House braves the Detroit housing market. And dream of sunnier climes with some beachy diversions.

title: Word + Quiz: supposititious
Your Five Senses
The Anonymous Woman: Picturing Domesticity and Identity
description: Patty Carroll has been exploring womens identity and their relationships to their domestic worlds  and always depicts them with their faces obscured.

title: President Trump vs. Big Bird
description: So what if President Trump wants to deport Big Bird?

title: Why Democrats Should Work With Trump
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump has discovered that trying to work with Republicans, like trying to work on health care policy, is complicated. So with all his big campaign pledges in limbo following last weeks Obamacare fiasco, he reportedly is contemplating overtures to a party that actually wants to govern: the Democrats.

title: Why I Support a Border-Adjustment Tax
description: MOUNT PROSPECT, ILL.  The United States corporate tax rate has been stuck at 35 percent for three decades. In that time, other leading countries have slashed their corporate rates to an average of 25 percent, with many far below that figure. This tax rate discrepancy puts domestic manufacturers at a competitive disadvantage and creates incentives for them to engage in inversions (using openings in the law to change their tax nationalities) or to move production and jobs offshore.

title: A Grand Bronx Plan Requires Local Input
description: The Sheridan Expressway has blighted its corner of the South Bronx since the 1960s. Of all the endless ribbons of pavement and cloverleaf spaghetti that the master planner Robert Moses laid upon the New York area, it isnt much  just a mile long, with six elevated lanes, between the Bruckner and Cross Bronx Expressways.

title: The Empty Supreme Court Confirmation Hearing
description: The Senate Judiciary Committees confirmation hearing for Judge Neil M. Gorsuch was just plain embarrassing, and not only for the nominee. But lets begin with him, skipping over his Republican enablers, who had nothing to do but lob softball questions and praise his answers. If Judge Gorsuch wasnt the least forthcoming Supreme Court nominee ever to appear at a confirmation hearing, its hard to imagine one who could be less forthcoming while still breathing. More interesting and less predictable answers could have come from Siri on an iPhone.

title: Trump Remembers the Ladies
description: Womens History Month is coming to an end. Donald Trump must be absolutely exhausted.

title: When the President Is Ignorant of His Own Ignorance
description: How prepared is our president for the next great foreign, economic or terrorist crisis?

title: North Carolinas Love of College Sports Spurred Move to Repeal Bathroom Law
description: The fate of North Carolinas controversial state law known as the bathroom bill was shaped by events in another state as much as by the political maneuvering that played out this week among lawmakers at the state house in Raleigh, N.C.

title: The Anonymous Woman: Picturing Domesticity and Identity
description: Patty Carroll was an established photographer and teacher in Chicago when in 1992 she moved to London, where her husband had gotten a job as rector of the Royal College of Art. She taught photography at what is now the University of the Arts London, but the move brought about an unexpected shift.

title: Questions for: Trumps Executive Order Pushes the U.S. Climate Pledge Further Out of Reach
description: Article: Trumps Executive Order Pushes the U.S. Climate Pledge Further Out of Reach

title: As Hong Kong Ponders Its Future Under Beijing, Politics Infuses Its Art
description: HONG KONG  As fewer than 1,200 electors were casting ballots on Sunday for Hong Kongs next leader, Sampson Wong was tagging Facebook videos that showed city residents making breakfast, riding trains and playing with cats.

title: The Best and Latest in Crime Fiction
description: When shes writing about her beloved Venice, Donna Leon can do no wrong. And EARTHLY REMAINS (Atlantic Monthly, $25), her new mystery featuring Commissario Guido Brunetti, is one of her best. Its also one of her saddest, dealing as it does with the seemingly unstoppable polluting of the great lagoon. Weve poisoned it all, killed it all, mourns Davide Casati, the aged caretaker of the house on the island of SantErasmo where Brunetti is taking a medical leave for job-induced stress.

title: A Larger-Than-Life Caribbean Stew
description: I was staying in a square cinder-block house on a dirt road outside the Lovely Bay settlement on Acklins Island in the southern Bahamas. This was a number of years ago, a fishing trip, long days spent out on the flats of the Bight of Acklins with a local guide named Fidel Johnson. Each night we returned to eat fiery stews prepared by his sister, Doramae Johnson. They were bright crimson affairs, perhaps familiar to those who have spent time eating in the islands of the Bahamas and Lesser Antilles. Doramae ginned them up from canned goods and fresh conchs, lobster, sometimes chicken or pork shipped in from Nassau, and served them on a small table in her brothers kitchen. They were bewilderingly delicious. I begged her for a recipe. She only smiled. I tried to come off the water early to cook with her. She was onto me. The stew was finished, left warm in the oven, and she was gone, her secrets kept.

title: The High Price of Leaving Ultra-Orthodox Life
description: On Thursdays, the nonprofit organization Footsteps hosts a drop-in group for its membership of formerly ultra-Orthodox Jews, who mostly refer to themselves as off the derech. Derech means path in Hebrew, and off the derech, or O.T.D. for short, is how their ultra-Orthodox families and friends refer to them when they break away from these tight-knit, impermeable communities, as in: Did you hear that Shaindels daughter Rivkie is off the derech? I heard she has a smartphone and has been going to museums. So even though the term is burdened with the yoke of the very thing they are trying to flee, members remain huddled together under O.T.D. on their blogs and in their Facebook groups, where their favored hashtag is #itgetsbesser  besser meaning better in Yiddish. Sometimes someone will pop up on a message board or in an email group and say, Shouldnt we decide to call ourselves something else? But it never takes. Reclamations are messy.

title: What Specialty College Would You Create?
description: In your ideal world, what type of college or university would you attend?

title: Letter of Recommendation: Life Magazine
description: Life magazine was like life itself for me for about 12 years of my early youth, until we stopped renewing our subscription. I remember the images of the Korean War, the movie Cleopatra, the funeral of William Faulkner (reported by William Styron), the space program and the Vietnam War. Lifes photographs were brave and brilliant, capturing the human moment. Reading Life in a bungalow in Medford, Mass., I beheld a world that was remote and alluring, places I would never see, parties I would never attend, millionaires and up-and-comers I would never know. It was how the mass of people lived, vicariously, following the fortunes of famous names in magazines; how they still live, overlooked, grinding away, not celebrated, not up-and-coming.

title: How to Feel at Home on the Road
description: Travel is, by definition, dislocating, a condition that the trend toward experiential travel and the connectivity provided by the internet aim to ease.

title: 36 Hours in Victoria Falls (Zimbabwe Side)
description: With adrenaline-pumping activities galore, there are countless ways to experience this enthralling natural wonder.

title: 5 Prosecutors With a Fresh Approach
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  They dont talk about locking up the bad guys and throwing away the key. They talk instead about a justice system that jails too many people at the expense, they say, of common sense, public safety and even humanity. Here are five change-minded prosecutors, all of them Democrats whose campaigns were funded by the billionare George Soros, and the causes they have championed.

title: A Home in Riverdale With Room to Work and Play
description: Nearly a dozen years ago, Jo Blackwell-Preston and Kamau Preston rented a two-bedroom in the Sugar Hill area of Harlem, switching to a three-bedroom in their building as their family grew.

title: Lock Em Up? Prosecutors Who Say Not So Fast Face a Backlash
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  In Tampa, the top prosecutor says too many children are charged as adults. In Houston, the district attorney will no longer press charges in low-level marijuana cases. And in Chicago, prosecutors will no longer oppose the release of many nonviolent offenders who cannot afford to post bond.

title: Brand New Colossus: A Statue of Liberty Revival Amid Immigration Woes
description: King Bradley was working his shift at the gift shop near the Statue of Liberty when something unusual happened.

title: Expert Opinion or Elaborate Ruse? Scrutiny for Scholars Role in Art Sales
description: They have long been oddly far-flung collaborators. She was a Colorado museum consultant known for her esoteric lectures on ancient gold adornments or nomadic Chinese tribes. He was a buccaneering Bangkok art collector who trekked through Cambodias war-ravaged jungles in the 1970s, exploring moss-encrusted temples built a thousand years earlier, during the heyday of Khmer civilization.

title: Trump Leaves Science Jobs Vacant, Troubling Critics
description: WASHINGTON  On the fourth floor of the Eisenhower Executive Office Building, the staff of the White House chief technology officer has been virtually deleted, down from 24 members before the election to, by Friday, only one.

title: Zoot Suit Draws Crowds and Decked-Out Fans in Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES  When Zoot Suit made its debut in New York in 1979, it was the first time a Chicano show had made it to Broadway. But the musical, by Luis Valdez, was a distinctly Los Angeles production: It was commissioned by the Mark Taper Forum and portrayed a 1940s murder trial involving zoot-suit-wearing Mexican-American youths known as pachucos. The trial is set against the backdrop of the infamous Zoot Suit riots, a series of racially motivated attacks against Mexican-Americans in summer 1943.

title: Stephen Colbert Thinks Wed Rather Keep Our Web Browsing to Ourselves
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. What do you think of it? What else are you interested in? Let us know: thearts@nytimes.com.

title: China Confirms Details of Trump-Xi Meeting at Mar-a-Lago
description: HONG KONG  President Xi Jinping of China will visit President Trump at his Mar-a-Lago estate in Florida next week, the Chinese Foreign Ministry said Thursday, confirming details of the two leaders first summit meeting.

title: Do DHA Supplements Make Babies Smarter?
description: Peruse the infant formula aisle, or check out the options for prenatal nutritional supplements, and youll find that nearly all these products boast a brain nourishing omega-3 fatty acid called DHA. But despite decades of research, its still not clear that DHA in formula boosts brain health in babies, or that mothers need to go out of their way to take DHA supplements.

title: Morning Agenda: Bill Ackman and His Huge Mistake
description: William A. Ackman  not usually known for his contrition  has said sorry.

title: 3 Men on Death Row in Louisiana Sue Over Solitary Confinement
description: Marcus Hamilton, Winthrop Eaton and Michael Perry were each convicted of first-degree murder and sentenced to death in Louisiana more than 25 years ago. But all three men are still alive. And all three have been living in solitary confinement for a quarter century or more.

title: Loving Robo Cat Needs Home
description: My 90-year-old mother is in a nursing home with dementia, and the one thing she has wanted ever since she got there is a kitten.

title: Good Schools, Affordable Homes: Finding Suburban Sweet Spots
description: We created a set of charts for several metropolitan areas that look at school quality, home price and commute. There are deals to be had.

title: When Its Baseball Forever
description: We know already that the 2017 baseball season will be different, because we know what were missing. Gone are the soothing soundtrack of Vin Scully and the stylish slugging of David Ortiz. The persistent misery of the Chicago Cubs has gone poof. And we wont have Ol A-Rod to kick around anymore, either.

title: Freedom of Expression: United, Puma and the Leggings Furor
description: Well, that didnt take long.

title: 150 Years After Sale of Alaska, Some Russians Have Second Thoughts
description: The reassertion of Russias greatness has been a motif of Vladimir V. Putins presidency, and his projection of military might and cyberpower is in part why Russian-American relations are at their lowest point since the end of the Cold War.

title: California Today: Zoot Suit Memories
description: Good morning.

title: After Slave Revelations, She Has a New Mission
description: Every other Tuesday, Onita Estes-Hicks, 80, spends three hours in a New York City seminary contemplating her past and, just as important, her future.

title: Trump Eases Combat Rules in Somalia Intended to Protect Civilians
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump has relaxed some of the rules for preventing civilian casualties when the American military carries out counterterrorism strikes in Somalia, laying the groundwork for an escalating campaign against Islamist militants in the Horn of Africa.

title: As the Maldives Gains Tourists, Its Losing Its Beaches
description: GURAIDHOO, Maldives  From the foyer of his small guesthouse some 100 feet from the shoreline, Mohamed Nizar, 52, was wondering how long his business could remain viable.

title: Sanders, Obama and Virginia
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: Fans Have Spoken: Indoor Football Team Wont Sign Greg Hardy
description: It was the kind of conundrum sports teams face all the time. Sign a player who could probably help you, or pass because of troubling off-the-field issues.

title: Driven | Acura NSX
description: Acura revives the beloved NSX name with a land rocket that produces 573 horsepower and gobs of torque, making drivers feel invincible. And it's also a hybrid.

title: Video Review: Acura NSX, a Supercar in Almost All Ways
description: Hondas Acura division  the first Japanese luxury marque in the United States  didnt aim for BMW and Mercedes the way Toyotas Lexus brand did. Acura took a rational and practical approach to premium sportiness, perhaps to a fault.

title: Kim Jong-nams Body Released by Malaysia to North Korea
description: Nine Malaysians who had been barred from leaving North Korea were allowed to depart on Thursday in a deal giving the North the remains of Kim Jong-nam, the slain half brother of its leader, the Malaysian government said.

title: We Must Fight Them: Trump Goes After Conservatives of Freedom Caucus
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump launched a vengeful tirade against conservatives in his own party on Thursday in an attempt to kick-start health care talks and show that he remains a force to be feared in the looming battles over the budget, a tax overhaul and infrastructure.

title: The Haves and Have-Nots of Cancer Care
description: When I decided to undergo a lumpectomy earlier this month after a diagnosis of D.C.I.S., I learned a new word that makes me grateful for my privileges but also worried about the privations of others. The word is lagniappe, a bonus, like the 13th doughnut in the purchased dozen. As I went through yet another operation, my way was eased by the kindness of friends and relatives.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Ghost in the Shell
description: The director Rupert Sanders narrates a scene featuring Scarlett Johansson.

title: Rupert Sanders Narrates a Scene From Ghost in the Shell
description: A cyborg takes a deep dive in this scene from Ghost in the Shell, the new live-action adaptation of a Japanese comic book. Here, the cyber-enhanced Major (Scarlett Johansson) goes inside the digital information found in a geisha robot to solve the mystery of how it was hacked. The robots digital memories are visualized as Major physically walks through them. The director Rupert Sanders discussed building robots, visualizing data onscreen and greasing up stuntmen for the sequence. Here are excerpts from that conversation.

title: As Auto Prices Rise, Used Cars Are Looking Shinier
description: Dennis McNabb had just started thinking about buying a roomier car last year when he suddenly had no choice. A heavy storm rolled across Texas and dropped golf-ball-size hail that pummeled his 2013 Hyundai Genesis and punched holes in the sedans windows.

title: Meet Evatar: The Lab Model That Mimics the Female Reproductive System
description: Researchers in the United States have created a model of a female reproductive system that is so close to the real thing it even simulates a menstrual cycle and pregnancy hormones.

title: Age of Empires: How 2 Dynasties of Art Forged Chinas Identity
description: No one does epic better than the Metropolitan Museum of Art. It brought Pergamon to New York last spring and got the balance of giant and delicate right. It flew in medieval Jerusalem, and kept its multicultural sprawl intact. Now, in the exhibition  Age of Empires: Chinese Art of the Qin and Han Dynasties (221 B.C.-A.D. 220), it brings us China becoming China in a big-picture take as strange and warm as life.

title: Oxford to Honor Jan Morris, Jeanette Winterson and Others With Portraits
description: LONDON  Oxford University, which recently came under fire from student protesters urging the removal of a statue of the imperialist Cecil Rhodes,  announced on Thursday that a diverse set of portraits would soon be put on display.

title: Cut the Cord, but Keep the Films? Here Are 3 Ways
description: As someone old enough to remember the Stop Pay TV! campaigns that movie theaters and affiliated parties mounted in the late 1960s  Dont let Pay TV be the monster in your living room, blared one such ad  I am occasionally amused that paying for televised entertainment is now pretty much a fact of life. As multidevice streaming rapidly evolves into something like the norm, the concept of cord-cutting has started becoming a reality for some viewers. Its difficult to find reliable data on how many households have given up cable TV and now get all their television via a streaming add-on like Roku, Amazon Fire or Google Chromecast.

title: Expanded 2026 FIFA World Cup Means More Slots for Africa, Asia and Americas
description: Its about to get a whole lot easier to qualify for the World Cup.

title: After Calling Nafta Worst Trade Deal, Trump Appears to Soften Stance
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump, who has called the North American Free Trade Agreement the worst trade deal ever signed by the United States, appears to have backed off his threat to abandon the deal and is instead proposing keeping major planks in place when he begins renegotiating it later this year.

title: Healthy Gums May Signal a Longer Life
description: Older women with gum disease or tooth loss are at increased risk of dying early, researchers report.

title: 9 Comic Book Heroes Who Could Come Out on the Big Screen
description: The best news about the revelation that one (only one?) of the Power Rangers may be gay has been the lack of calls to boycott the film. In the brief but much-talked-about scene, the colorful teammates of the Yellow Ranger realize that she may be having girlfriend  not boyfriend  problems. It is a quiet moment and a small step forward for the representation of diverse sexuality in superhero movies. What stands out even more is that moviegoers didnt bat an eye, propelling the film to a surprisingly strong $40.5 million opening weekend.

title: Twitter Bot  or Not?
description: Q. How do I know if a Twitter account following me is a bot or a person?

title: Hepatitis Tied to Parkinsons Risk
description: Hepatitis infection may increase the risk for Parkinsons disease, though the reasons for the link remain unknown.

title: Elena Ferrante Series Coming to HBO
description: Ferrante Fever is coming to HBO.

title: Bathroom Law Repeal Leaves Few Pleased in North Carolina
description: ATLANTA  For a year, it prompted boycotts, demonstrations and economic fallout that helped dethrone a sitting governor. In the end, in a strange and profoundly American collision of polarized politics, big-time sports, commerce and the culture wars, North Carolinas notorious House Bill 2 was finally laid to rest on Thursday  though many were left wondering if some of its negative effects might linger.

title: At The Times, Roger Wilkins Fought Injustice. And The Times.
description: Roger Wilkins would not be trifled with.

title: Turning a Nightmare of Ghoulish Obscenities Into a Ballet
description: Ballets have been inspired by fairy tales, myths, poems, novels and Shakespeare plays, among other things. But never by a documentary that exposed the harrowing conditions at a state prison for the criminally insane.

title: Tech Roundup: The Latest in the Google-Uber Fracas
description: The long-running rivalry between Uber and Google has taken many twists and turns. The two companies have been competing to hire talent and to race ahead of each other in technologies like driverless cars.

title: Vladimir Putin, in First Remarks on Russian Protests, Warns of Potential Chaos
description: ARKHANGELSK, Russia  Breaking five days of silence  and a virtual Soviet-style blackout on state news media  over the biggest protests in Russia in years, President Vladimir V. Putin responded publicly on Thursday to the nationwide anticorruption demonstrations with a familiar message: aprs moi, le dluge.

title: Harvey Fierstein in Gently Down the Stream at the Public Theater
description: The four-time Tony winner Harvey Fierstein has always had a way with intrepid romantics. Beau, his character in Martin Shermans new play, Gently Down the Stream, is more on the cautious side. Having come of age as a gay man in a world where that was taboo, he has spent a lifetime trying to find love with men taught not to express it. But for Rufus, a young lawyer played by the Tony winner Gabriel Ebert (Matilda the Musical), the same inhibitions do not apply. Intergenerational romance ensues.

title: Neerob
description: Steam tables loaded with Bangladeshi delights are tucked away inside a halal chicken restaurant in the Bronx.

title: Bangladeshi Flavors Alongside Burgers and Chicken at Neerob
description: Last spring, on the street known as Bangla Bazaar in the Parkchester section of the Bronx, the Bangladeshi restaurant Neerob  thought by many to be the citys best  vanished.

title: 2 White House Officials Helped Give Nunes Intelligence Reports
description: WASHINGTON  A pair of White House officials helped provide Representative Devin Nunes of California, a Republican and the chairman of the House Intelligence Committee, with the intelligence reports that showed that President Trump and his associates were incidentally swept up in foreign surveillance by American spy agencies.

title: Like Old Times as Venus Williams Beats a No. 1 and Her Father Beams
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla.  Right now, Venus Williams seems to be playing every point as if it were the final point of her tennis career.

title: Israel Approves First New Settlement in Decades
description: JERUSALEM  Israels government on Thursday approved the establishment of a new settlement in the West Bank for the first time in more than two decades, and also laid the groundwork for further expansion despite a request from President Trump to hold off on settlement activity.

title: A Long Separation
description: Lynsey Addario first photographed Chuol, a South Sudanese boy fleeing violence, in 2015. She visited him at the Kakuma Refugee Camp in Kenya in 2016 to deliver a message from his family.

title: Mother and Son, Separated During South Sudans Civil War, Make Contact
description: One night in May 2015, a group of armed men from the Dinka tribe rampaged a small Nuer village in South Sudan, raping women, thrashing and pillaging homes and executing residents. This attack was one of many violent episodes near the town of Leer at the time. While many hoped that South Sudans newfound independence in 2011 might be the antidote to years of conflict with Sudan, a fragile power-sharing agreement between South Sudans president and vice president broke down in December 2013, unleashing a brutal civil war, pitting ethnic Dinka against Nuer.

title: Democrats Options as the Supreme Court Vote Nears
description: To the Editor:

title: Liked Serial? Heres Why the True-Crime Podcast S-Town Is Better
description: In 2014, the true-crime podcast Serial began like this: A tipster asked a radio journalist to investigate a murder. S-Town, the new narrative podcast from the creators of Serial, kicks off in a similar fashion. This time, the tipster is John B. McLemore, an eccentric antique clock restorer from Woodstock, Ala. The journalist is Brian Reed, a longtime producer for This American Life. When Mr. McLemore tells Mr. Reed that a Woodstock rich boy got away with murder and has been bragging about it ever since, Mr. Reed agrees to head down from New York to check it out. But it soon becomes clear that the homicide story is a bit of a red herring. Its the hook to get Mr. Reed on the line.

title: Senate Lets States Defund Clinics That Perform Abortions
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Republicans, aided by Vice President Mike Pence and an ailing Georgia colleague who gingerly made his way to the Capitol with the aid of a wheelchair and a walker, voted Thursday to undo an Obama administration rule preventing states from blocking funding for family planning clinics that also provide abortions.

title: Mets Add Zack Wheeler and Robert Gsellman to Rotation
description: The Mets answered most of their lingering roster questions on Thursday, and in doing so gave a big morale boost to Zack Wheeler, who missed the past two seasons after Tommy John and forearm surgery and, at least for now, is in the starting rotation.

title: Britain, Breaking Up With E.U., Looks to an Expert: Henry VIII
description: LONDON  When Henry VIIIs marital troubles got out of hand in the 16th century, they prompted a schism with the pope and Britains big break with the theological leadership of Continental Europe.

description: Staples like motorcycle jackets and chokers get dressed up in sophisticated new ways.

title: Streaming Drives U.S. Music Sales Up 11% in 2016
description: For the last year or so, the music industry has been buzzing with optimism that its fortunes have finally begun to turn around after more than a decade of digital disruption and plunging sales. Now it has proof.

description: Which Democrats are attempting to block President Trumps Supreme Court nominee.

title: Sears and Its Hedge Fund Owner, in Slow Decline Together
description: Hedge funds have been failing over the last year at the fastest rate since the financial crisis in 2008. Some crashed and burned after sudden reversals. Others quietly liquidated.

title: O Brother, Where Art Thou? Getting Him to Moms Big Birthday
description: My older brother, who is 30, and I were never close. I had hoped we would be as we got older. But his relationship with his girlfriend of three years has only made things worse. They live in Washington, D.C., and only visit her family in Florida. Were lucky if we see him once a year (and always with her). In January, I asked him to save a weekend in May for our moms 60th birthday. He said: May is busy. We may not make it. I exploded. If it was her mothers birthday, they would make it. We havent spoken since. Was I wrong?

title: Serbia Prepares to Elect a President Amid a Murky Media Landscape
description: BELGRADE, Serbia  When he was Serbias information minister in the late 1990s, Aleksandar Vucic censored journalists, forced media critics out of business and served as chief propagandist for the regime of Slobodan Milosevic, the Serbian strongman reviled for the atrocities that followed the breakup of Yugoslavia.

description: To the Editor:

title: Venezuela Muzzles Legislature, Moving Closer to One-Man Rule
description: IQUITOS, Peru  Venezuela took its strongest step yet toward one-man rule under the leftist President Nicols Maduro as his loyalists on the Supreme Court seized power from the National Assembly in a ruling late Wednesday night.

title: Armed Herders Invade I Dreamed of Africa Authors Land in Kenya
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  The woman who wrote I Dreamed of Africa, one of the most successful contemporary Africa books, is now living a nightmare.

description: To the Editor:
