title: Voyeur: Early Spring Flowers
description: Just living is not enough.  One must have sunshine, freedom, and a little flower.

title: Lone Star to Buy Controlling Stake in Portugals Novo Banco
description: LONDON  The Bank of Portugal, that nations central bank, said on Friday that it would sell a controlling stake in a bank salvaged from the collapse of one of the countrys largest private lenders, to Lone Star Funds, an American private equity firm.

title: What Were Reading
description: New York Times reporters and editors are highlighting great stories from around the web. You can receive What Were reading by email, and let us know how you like it at wwr@nytimes.com.

title: Trump Is President. Now Encrypt Your Email.
description: In the weeks after Donald J. Trump won the election, a schism threatened to break my group of friends in two. Not a political argument brought about by the president-elect, or a philosophical fight over the future of the country, but a question of which app we should be using to chat: GroupMe or Signal?

title: Review: An Absent Baritone Looms Over the Met Operas Onegin
description: For fans of the baritone Dmitri Hvorostovsky, the return of Tchaikovskys Eugene Onegin to the Metropolitan Opera on Thursday was a bittersweet occasion. He had been scheduled to sing the title role, one of his signatures. But in December Mr. Hvorostovsky, who has been undergoing treatment for brain cancer, announced that he would have to withdraw from staged performances for the foreseeable future. Stepping in was Mariusz Kwiecien, who was paired with the soprano who starred with him when this Deborah Warner production opened the Mets 2013-14 season: Anna Netrebko.

title: Canada Today: Next Step for Refugees, a Big Coin and Trade
description: Each week, Canada Today mixes the Timess recent Canada-related coverage with back stories and analysis from our reporters along with opinions from our readers.

title: The Shift Festival: A Reincarnation, With Cherry Blossoms
description: WASHINGTON  Rain is usually an outdoor performances worst nightmare. But on Wednesday morning at the Tidal Basin here, members of the Boulder Philharmonic were enveloped in the most delightful kind of showers imaginable. Seated under Japanese cherry trees near the Franklin Delano Roosevelt Memorial, squinting slightly against the bright sunshine, a quintet of wind soloists was playing a breezy minuet by Haydn while periodic gusts of wind shook loose hundreds of petals, sprinkling the players and their audience of tourists and stroller-pushing parents in a gentle swirl of pink.

title: From Cobb to Cubs:
description: His nickname was the Georgia Peach, but he was anything but that. Instead, Ty Cobb played for a quarter of a century with a spikes-up intensity that barely knew any boundaries.

title: The Best TV Shows and Movies New to Netflix, Amazon and More in April
description: Here are the titles we think are most interesting, broken down by service.

title: Watch the Works of Liz Lerman, Winner of 2017 Jacobs Pillow Dance Award
description: Liz Lerman, a didactic choreographer who has devoted her career to community engagement through dance, is this years recipient of the Jacobs Pillow Dance Award.

title: Friday Night Music: San Fermin, Belong
description: Ive been remiss about music lately  too much going on, and not managing to go to enough concerts! But heres the gorgeous title track from the album dropping next week. Unfortunately, all the live performances from the album so far have disappointing sound quality  too bad given how great this band is to watch  so heres the official lyric video:

title: Meet the Shareholders? Not at These Shareholder Meetings
description: Companies can use technology to be open and transparent with their stakeholders, or they can deploy it to go underground. Now, as this years shareholder meeting season begins, investors are taking aim at directors whose companies use technology as a shield against accountability.

title: How to Throw a Baseball
description: Baseball is a game of gaps. No other sport uses the grand term Opening Day for its first round of contests, and no other athletic tilt, with the possible ancestral exception of cricket, is so dependent on hitting a ball where someone isnt while throwing it where someone is. Baseball is a game of aim, and as the new season opens, with my beloved Blue Jays poised for another run in the hypercompetitive American League East, my thoughts turn to the very idea of aiming.

title: Already Facing Death, Dylann Roof Cuts Deal for Added Life Term
description: Eleven weeks after a federal jury condemned Dylann S. Roof to death for killing nine worshipers at a black church in Charleston, S.C., state prosecutors announced on Friday that they would end a separate case by allowing him to plead guilty to murder in exchange for a life sentence.

title: Sean Spicer Repeats Trumps Unproven Wiretapping Allegation
description: WASHINGTON  The White House on Friday revived President Trumps unproven wiretapping allegations against the Obama administration, insisting that there is new evidence that it conducted politically motivated surveillance of Mr. Trumps presidential campaign.

title: Opinion: After a Historic March, Whats Next for Women?
description: Last week, we were treated to a news photo that will live in infamy: two dozen white male Republican congressmen (and zero women) around a White House conference table talking about dumping maternity and newborn care as part of their replacement for the Obama health care law.

title: The Next Battle in the War Over Planned Parenthood
description: WASHINGTON  Cecile Richards, the president of Planned Parenthood Federation of America, was poring over a spiral notebook in her bare-bones office here when she was asked about President Trumps latest attempt to cut a deal on abortion.

title: March, Huddle, Fight: Why Feminism Is Back in a Big Way
description: People have been declaring feminism dead forever, and after Donald J. Trumps election victory it was tempting to wonder if the naysayers were onto something.

title: Will Overseas Regulators Trust the States to Watch Insurers?
description: States in the United States will need to bolster their credibility with the European Union.

title: For George Takei, Beyond Star Trek to a Graphic Novel
description: George Takei, who is perhaps best known for playing the helmsman Hikaru Sulu on the original Star Trek television and film series, is boldly going into a new arena: graphic novels.

title: Roy Williams? He Doesnt Have an Accent. You Have an Accent.
description: BLACK MOUNTAIN, N.C.  If Michael Jordan is the most famous North Carolina Tar Heel and second place goes to the legendary coach Dean Smith, then somewhere in the top five lies Roy Williamss mouth.

title: No Room for Dissent in Womens Movement Today
description: Is there a womens movement in 2017? What is it? Who is it?

title: On Campus, Embracing Feminism and Facing the Future
description: One of the things Tina Campt, a professor and director of the Barnard Center for Research on Women, has noticed about the young women in her classes is their radically open notion of sexuality and gender.

title: A Conductors Falsetto: This Weeks 8 Best Classical Music Moments
description: In addition to reviews, features and news during the week, our critics and reporters collect the best of what theyve heard: notes that sent shivers down their spines, memorable voices, quotations that cut to the heart of the story.

title: Our Best Guidance for Filing Your Tax Return
description: Are you filing with an online tool? Seeing a professional? Have you thought about your H.S.A.? Are you just out of time and need to file an extension?

title: A Mysterious Flash From a Faraway Galaxy
description: It was a spark in the night. A flash of X-rays from a galaxy hovering nearly invisibly on the edge of infinity.

title: Report on New York City Incarceration Reform
description: A report by an independent commission, created by the City Council last year to study the era of mass incarceration in New York, recommended moving inmates off Rikers Island and into a system of smaller jails.

title: Obamacare Choices Could Go From One to Zero in Some Areas
description: Parts of the country are in jeopardy of not having an insurer offering Obamacare plans next year.

title: A Blockheaded Social Science Experiment. On Purpose.
description: They came from Westchester, Brooklyn, Long Island and the Bronx  actors young and old, seasoned and fresh out of the gate, summoned by casting agents for a rather curious gig: To stand around Astor Place in Manhattan early Thursday with mirrored cubes over their heads.

title: Now Netflix Is All Thumbs
description: Netflix, as you may have heard, is killing off its stars. At a recent news conference at its headquarters in Los Gatos, Calif., the company announced it was shedding its former one-to-five-star rating system in favor of binary digits: namely, thumbs up or thumbs down.

title: What to Cook, Watch, Listen To and More This Weekend
description: If a mans friends do not take enough interest in him to play a few April Fool jokes on him to-day, he might as well go to a monastery and stay there. Or so said The Times on April 1, 1892.

title: Trump Talks Tough on U.S.-China Trade but Delays Real Action
description: SHANGHAI  President Trump appeared to follow through on Friday on his promises to get tough on trade with China, less than a week before he is to meet with President Xi Jinping of China.

title: Flynn, Gorsuch, Atlanta: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Martin Margiela Comes Back Into the Spotlight (Not That He Ever Left)
description: For a fashion designer who retired eight years ago and who is famously reclusive, Martin Margiela is remarkably present in fashion today: His work  if not his actual likeness  influences a whole swath of contemporary designers.

title: Sean Spicer Misquotes Evelyn Farkas in Latest Defense of Trumps Wiretapping Claim
description: WASHINGTON  Sean Spicer, the White House press secretary, continued on Friday to use misdirection and misleading claims to defend President Trumps contention that former President Barack Obama spied on him, as well as Mr. Trumps refusal to release his tax returns.

title: The Endangered Antiquities Act
description: The heart of the Antiquities Act of 1906 is a mere two sentences. But a good argument can be made that this brief law  which authorizes the president to protect objects of historic or scientific interest on federal lands as national monuments  has done more than any other to shape our nations conservation legacy.

title: Response From Sessions and Kelly to Californias Chief Judge on Immigration
description: Attorney General Jeff Sessions and John F. Kelly, the homeland security secretary, chastised California's chief justice in a letter this week after she complained of federal immigration agents "stalking" courthouses to make arrests.

title: U.S. Officials Chastise Judge Who Complained of Agents Stalking
description: LOS ANGELES  Top law enforcement officials from the Trump administration chastised Californias chief judge this week, saying that it was troubling that she described federal immigration agents as stalking local courthouses in order to arrest undocumented immigrants.

title: F.B.I. Reunites a Rockwell, Stolen 40 Years Ago, With Its Owners
description: PHILADELPHIA  No matter where the Grant family lived, the Norman Rockwell painting of a chubby boy resting against a tree had always been hung in a place where it was sure to be seen. Robert Grants children knew that painting  the one he bought for $50 or $100, depending on whom you ask  was something their father had treasured.

title: For April Ryan, Clashes With the White House Bring a New Kind of Prominence
description: WASHINGTON  By the time April D. Ryan left the White House briefing room on Tuesday, she was already making headlines: on live television, President Trumps press secretary, Sean M. Spicer, had cut off her questions to chastise her for what he deemed an inappropriate shake of her head.

title: William T. Coleman Jr., Who Broke Racial Barriers in Court and Cabinet, Dies at 96
description: William T. Coleman Jr., who championed the cause of civil rights in milestone cases before the Supreme Court and who rose above racial barriers himself as an influential lawyer and as a cabinet secretary, died on Friday at his home in Alexandria, Va. He was 96.

title: 2 Sue Trump and U.S. Officials, Claiming They Are on Kill List
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Two men who have reported extensively on jihadists and their activities have sued President Trump and members of his administration based on their belief that the government has put them on a kill list meant for terrorists, according to court documents.

title: Closing Rikers Island Is a Moral Imperative
description: The time has come to close Rikers Island.

title: Reporting the Reporting, Step by Step
description: The great challenge and great pleasure of being a reporter chasing a developing story is having no idea what the day will hold. If you start to imagine a loose framework for your article, the facts you gather  and surprises along the way  are liable to blow it apart.

title: Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner Still Benefiting From Business Empire, Filings Show
description: Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner, President Trumps daughter and son-in-law, will remain the beneficiaries of a sprawling real estate and investment business still worth as much as $740 million, despite their new government responsibilities, according to ethics filings released by the White House Friday night.

title: Videos of Force-Feeding at Guantnamo Will Stay Secret, Court Rules
description: WASHINGTON  The military is allowed to keep secret at least 28 videotapes showing guards at the Guantnamo Bay wartime prison extracting a hunger-striking detainee from his cell and then force-feeding him, a federal appeals court ruled on Friday.

title: Trump, the Centrist President
description: LOS ANGELES  When President Trump retreats from a fight, he tends to do so with guns blazing. After a few days of hinting that he might be willing to work with congressional Democrats, this week he unloaded on the Republican Freedom Caucus with both barrels. Mr. Trump learned long ago to never admit a mistake, so  his Twitter attack on Thursday placing the blame for the failure of health care legislation on those conservative Republicans was designed to clear the path for him to reach across party lines.

title: In the Air Over Vietnam
description: The heat was suffocating as we got off the Continental charter flight that late summer afternoon in 1966 at South Vietnams sprawling Bien Hoa Air Base, but I was more amazed at the incredible activity everywhere. There were other charter planes arriving, constant flights of F-100 and F-5 fighters taking off and landing, lumbering C-130 transports loading and unloading. There was a U-2 circling above the base as it soared to high altitudes for a reconnaissance mission. There were lines of soldiers getting onto another Continental flight, heading home. I soon learned that the thing everyone in the military kept track of, even more than the daily body count, was the countdown to rotating home  121 days and counting, someone would say. I was scheduled to rotate home in late 1967.

title: Ranks of Political Prisoners Grow as Democracy Ebbs in Venezuela
description: For Braulio Jatar, it was the biggest scoop in years: Venezuelas president was being chased by a crowd screaming of hunger, banging on pots and pans.
